title: Piece of junk
content: The motor hums, but the blades don't turn.  I would have tried to return it, but my man decided to try to fix it and broke the housing because it doesn't come apart to clean or anything.

title: Two Irritating Problems
content: I purchased this fan knowing that other reviewers had a problem with the pivoting fan head holding the selected position. I hoped that this condition had either been fixed, as it is a Honeywell, or it was not as bad as indicated by other reviewers. It has not been fixed and it is every bit as bad as indicated by others. Additionally, as I had the fan on a GFI outlet, I found that, when opeating the ON/OFF fan speed switch from one position to another, it opened the GFI outlet shutting off the fan. The fan has been returned to Amazon.

title: Good
content: I buy these at Home Depot usually.  This one is a little under powered compared to the Home Depot version.  It does work pretty well though.

title: Three Stars
content: Too quiet, we use for white noise to sleep.

title: Itsa fan.... Moves a decent amount ...
content: Itsa fan....  Moves a decent amount of air for its size.

title: Good little fan that moves quite a bit of air.
content: Blew fuse within 2 hours of use.  Comes with a spare.  Switched it out and has worked ever since.  Not sure everyone would know to replace the fuse in the outlet plug.  This replaced prior unit we have had for 3 years that runs quite a bit.  Feel as though we got our money out of the last one, so hopefully this one last as long.  Moves a lot of air and is quiet.

title: Three Stars
content: It runs fine, but is not very powerful.

title: Three Stars
content: It's just too quiet!

title: Three Stars
content: Good quality took forever to arrive.

title: seems like a cheap internal notched piece where stand meets fan
content: plastic fan.  used 1/2 dozen times and the position adjustment part broke.  seems like a cheap internal notched piece where stand meets fan.  the force of the fan just moves and directs it where it want to go.  will not hold in position.  fairly quiets - not silent, moves air well for this size of a fan. used it in my camper bedroom at night, now just blows up towards the ceiling.

title: It was a great fan while it lasted though
content: This stop working after about 5 months. I have no idea why it stopped working, it just one day decided to stop working. It was a great fan while it lasted though.

title: Garbage.
content: Worked well for about 2 weeks until (I assume) the motor blew, as it simply stopped working. Not worth the $15.

title: But it is a good looking fan
content: Fan moved air very well, but our conference room does not have any Window, , the fan blow only warm air. But it is a good looking fan.

title: Overheats, motor smells like it's burning
content: I bought this fan for use in a nursery as a white noise maker and for air circulation. It's the right size, is quiet enough to sleep with it on, yet loud enough to drown out household noise, has multiple tilt settings, three speeds, etc... I used it almost nightly, and during daytime naps. For about a month... then...

title: Horrible smell started after 2 months of use...
content: I have the exact same Honeywell fan in black and it has worked fabulously for over a year.  I had been using the black version of this fan in my toddler's bedroom as white noise, but purchased the white one because it matched better with the decor in her room.  BIG MISTAKE!  After two months of continuous use, there was a horrific oder in the baby's room that smelled like burning electrical wires.  After spending a few weeks performing various troubleshooting activities such as moving out the cloth diaper pail and replacing the electrical outlets in the room, I was convinced there was a dead animal frying in the wiring somewhere within the walls.  I decided to unplug everything in the room (again) and I finally pulled out the fan and noticed the motor itself was the source of a substantial electrical smell.  I plugged the fan into a small bathroom thinking maybe the outlet was to blame and sure enough within 5 minutes the bathroom had the same burning electrical smell.  I have no idea why the white version of the same fan has this problem, but the black fan has been back in the baby's room operating 24/7 with no problems for months.

title: Worked for 31 days
content: Worked for 31 days.  Just long enough to pass the return period.  Fan started to smell like electrical burn and then motor crapped out.  If you need a fan for just a month than buy this fan!

title: Honeywell is slipping in quality
content: I have owned several of these fans and the quality has decreased every couple years. This version feels like a cheaper, noisier, clone of the product it replaced.

title: Stops working in less then 6 months
content: DO NOT GET THIS FAN! I use this fan at college to cool down my room and it stops working in less than 4 months. Terrible product!

title: Buy a Vornado instead
content: I have another Honeywell fan in white/cream and I also have a Vornado.  I bought this additional Honeywell to save some money, but the quality isn't near that of the Vornado.  This Honeywell has a tendency to not hold it's vertical alignment and it's annoying while working out.

title: This is a fan?  Must be because it BLOWS!
content: This is absolutely the saddest excuse for a fan I have ever encountered.  On the highest setting, I can easily place the fan 2 inches from my face without the "air stream" even moving an eyelash.  Please do not market your product using the word "POWER," unless of course you are only doing so to describe needing an electrical outlet to slightly turn the blade to whisper out the modest puff of air this product produces.

title: Quiet Motor and Burnt Rubber Smell.
content: I bought this fan for white noise and air circulation. The fan is too quiet for white noise.  After operating for 30 minutes the fan emits a burnt smell odor.  I returned the fan.

title: Broke
content: The fan stopped working after only a day or two. Thinking it might be the fuse, I replaced it with the spare provided. No luck.

title: Honeywell TurboFarce
content: I have owned this fan for three years now, but I really wish that I had chosen a different brand.  The problem is that the fan points itself straight up to the ceiling everytime you turn it on!  There doesn't seem to be anyway of tightening the hinges, so I have been forced to hold the direction of the fan in place using strapping tape.  I sincerely doubt that was the intention of the engineers who designed this fan.

title: Fan failed
content: Fan Failed after three months. I have never had a fan die so soon. If you are looking for a durable/ lasting fan, Do Not Buy This One! What a loss of $28.00.

title: fan motor burnt up in the first two minutes of use
content: had the fan shipped to me in Afghanastan to help drown out the outside noise while I slept, received the fan plugged it in ran fine for about two minutes the it shut off and thats when I saw smoke coming from the motor, now I'm stuck with a fan that doesnt work and will cost me almost as much to return as a new one would

title: Vendor Bad, Fan Not Size Described
content: This fan is described as being 16" tall.  That is wrong.  It is in fact 14" tall.  It is not a floor fan.  I also purchased this through The Nerds.  Their page claimed I could not return it after I ordered it -- in violation of Amazon's policy.  Of course that page only showed up once I started processing my return.  I contacted The Nerds, and did not hear back from them until I wrote them an annoyed letter some days later.  Then they sent me a return address which required that I pay the postage -- again in violation of Amazon's policy.  I complained again.  Again it took them several days to get back to me.  This time they provided a fed ex pre-paid bar code.  What didn't they do that the first time?  Are they evading their customers?  They have a rather sneaky/sleazy attitude.  I have no patience for that kind of behavior and will not be buying anything from them in the future.

title: Avoid this product
content: After a previous good experience with a different, smaller Honeywell fan (that model is sadly no longer available) my wife and I tried this one. Big mistake.

title: MY COUGH BLOWS MORE WIND!!!
content: MY COUGH BLOWS MORE WIND, I BOUGHT THIS FOR MY DAUGHTERS ROOM. THE FAN IS NOT BIG IT IS SMALL SO DO PAY ATTENTION TO THE SIZE IF YOU ARE ORDERING AND THE THING BLOWS NOTHING HARDLY, I HAD TO BUY HER ANOTHER FAN!!!!!!!!1

title: Hate it
content: This fan does not turn - Also, it is not strong enough compared to other fans it's same size. Save your money!

title: Noisy
content: Fan makes clicking sound as it spins very, which makes it very noisy and annoying...other than that its awesome just sucks cause the clicking noise drives ou crazy

title: too Quiet.
content: We like fans that make noise. This one is super quiet. So if guess if you want a quiet fan - this review should be a FIVE star!!

title: I hate this fan.
content: My previous Honeywell fan finally died so I went in search of a new one.  This fan looks IDENTICAL to the one that died on me, but not at all the same.  Out of the box it felt very cheap compared to the dead one.  The base is half the size and made of what feels like a cheaper plastic.  The real disappointment was when I turned it on.  I use my fan primarily as a tool to help me fall asleep.  Most of the time it just faces the ceiling and the constant whirling sends me off into a blissful slumber.  I turned this thing on low and could barely feel it; couldn't even hear it.  I skipped straight to MAXIMUM POWER! and was literally shocked with how pathetic this fan performed.  The high setting on this fan pushes less air than the low setting on my previous Honeywell.  I'm not really sure what they mean by "TurboForce" I'm sure I'm not the first to call BS on that.  False advertising to anyone who has owned a true Honeywell fan.  They lost me as a customer.  Shame on you Honeyfail.

title: Not Much Power
content: Very small fan that  does not have much power . If you want something that you can set on the floor and give you a small breeze without  blowing papers everywhere  this is the fan. Quiet enough can be used in office  .If you want  a fan that  will circulate air or cool you down this is not it .

title: no good for the UK
content: TOTAL WASTE  OF MONEY DIDN'T FIT PUG  SOCKETS BOUGHT ADAPTERS AND STILL DIDN'T FIT AS I BOUGHT SIX

title: DO NO BUY!!!  SMASH IT
content: This honeywell fan blows very little air out on high setting feels like it's on low.

title: Not for Me!
content: This is the second one i've bought it 3 months. They don't last. I live in a 3rd floor apartment so I like to use it in the summer to push the cool air. While it does work well when it works, the motor burns out quickly. I don't move the fan. I've keep it in one place running about 8 hours a day for 3 months. Well, I woke up this morning to plug in the fan and the motor won't turn. I tried cleaning it out. Still nothing...No more Honeywell for me.

title: Poor Quality
content: Poor quality. Won't maintain a constant speed. Don't waste your money on this one. Will buy better quality next time.

title: Stopped working the third time I used it.
content: I have several Honeywell fans and I like them. This one, unfortunately, was purchased in May but not turned on until July.  It worked a couple times and then just would not turn on.  Maybe a bad switch.  My return time is up at Amazon and I don't even know if I'll get a refund or replacement.  I guess I'll send it back and find out.

title: VERY low air movement
content: I know that HoneyWell has a good reputation, but I was VERY disappointed when we plugged this fan in and turned it on high. Their high feature is most small fan's LOW feature. And the crazy thing is that this fan has a medium and low speed that moves next to NO air. My wife uses fans while she sleeps just for the sound, and this fan moves such little air, that it doesnt make any sound! If you want a quiet fan this might be yours! I know it's an inexpensive fan, but we have bought $15 to $20 fans that put out way more air. I was extremely disappointed in this purchase, and I rarely leave negative reviews on Amazon.

title: Doesn't work
content: It is Already not working after having it a very very short time. Less than 2 months. I was surprised.

title: Broke after 8 months
content: EDIT: I purchased this fan in September and by April both sides that connected to the stand had cracked and broken. The covers completely fell off. The fan still worked, but because it couldn't stand up, it was pretty much useless. Instead of attempting to rig it with superglue or duct tape, I contacted Amazon. They were great and let me return it as a defective product even though the original refund time had well passed. I'm ordering a Vornado instead.

title: dead
content: came fast, and worked great for about two days. it just stopped working the other day.  it is still clean and looks fine but it will not run anymore.  i suggest paying more for a better fan.

title: Weak!
content: This fan is a joke. Its VERY weak, even on the high setting. My blow dryer is more powerful. I have a Holmes Blizzard fan and when it comes to blowing power, that thing cranks! Don't bother wasting your money on this one. I've had many floor fans over the years, including a Vornado (awesome) and I think this is the weakest fan I've purchased.

title: Not a USB-powered Fan
content: This is listed as a USB-powered fan (Electronics › Computers & Accessories › Cables & Accessories › USB Fans). It is not a USB fan. As that is what I purchased this for, this fan was not useable for me.

title: Broke in 3 months
content: The fan was quiet.  But it didn't move as much air as the older units.  But the biggest problem is it stopped working after less than 3 months.  No warning, no noises, just stopped working.  It would be a good idea to try a different manufacturer.

title: Broken hinges after two months of use!
content: Originally I wrote a positive review, but I am now updating my review of this fan from positive to negative. I purchased my first fan and I thought it had good power, so I ordered a second one. After a couple months both of the fans had broken hinges which rendered them unusable. The way they are constructed, I cannot even fix this problem. I noticed that other customers have had similar problems.

title: WOULD NOT RECOMEND
content: IT IS VERY SMALL, PACKED IN AN OVERSIZE BOX TO MAKE IT LOOK BIGGER, BUT IT IS WAY TOO SMALL.  QUALITY DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE ALL THAT GREAT EITHER, AND IT IS WAY OVER PRICED FOR WHAT YOU GET.  VERY DISSAPOINTED.

title: Don't waste your money
content: Very slow speed, noisy. Cheaply made, would not ever recommend this product to anyone. Will be going to Goodwill very shortly.

title: Fine while it works...
content: This product died after less than three months of use. It hums when plugged in and turned on, but the fan doesn't work. Do not buy this.

title: Pure garbage.
content: I bought this fan because I needed one for my bedroom, and I was seriously disappointed with it. For one, the fan itself stopped working for no reason at all, and for two, the screws to take the fan apart, (terrible idea by the way,) would not come undone, so the fan had to literally be cut by a butcher knife in order to take it apart.

title: Turbo-FARCE
content: I purchased two of these fans. An eighty year old with emphysema could blow a stronger wind (from either orifice!

title: Stopped working
content: Stopped working after about a week.  Started making a terrible squealing noise and then died.  Would start and stop randomly before dying.  At least it didn't burn down my house.

title: Honeywell Whole Room Air Circulator Floor/Table Fan,HT-908
content: This item arrived with a broken fan stand.....I returned it for credit !!  It was very disappointing to me and my husband......

title: Beware of broken hinges
content: I ordered and sent back 4 of these fans...one after another.  I'm guessing they were damaged during transit, but I'm also guessing that if yours wasn't damaged, it will crack after some moderate use.  The hinge/bracket that holds the fan to the base is made of very thin plastic and cracks easily.  One fan arrived completely broken from one leg.  The other three had cracks of varying sizes on that hinge.  It worked, but was only a matter of time until it cracked all the way through.  I'm looking for another brand of better quality.

title: Died after a month of use
content: The fan stopped working after a month.. Really upset me.. This is a thirty dollar fan... That's just ridiculous if you as me..

title: WHERE DO I START?
content: This tops the list of the worst things I ever ordered on Amazon. Straight out of the box, it starts making an annoying noise that makes you think there's something obstructing the blades; who knows there might actually be something in there but that's not the real problem. It's still winter in Chicago so you can imagine how sparingly I used this before returning it. On one of the rare occasions that I used it, it started like a car engine and then slowly, the blades stopped turning while the motor engine kept buzzing like a clipper. I thought there may have been a power surge but then I hit it gently at the back and it started off again. I experienced this two more times and decided it was best to return it. I'll keep searching for something that really works and would never recommend this to anyone.

title: Bought in September, stopped working 4 months later
content: We used it sparingly, never dropped it, etc. Surprised at a Honeywell device being so fragile, our other Honeywell fan is 15 years old and running still. Seems like I should be able to return this one after such a poor experience.

title: They didn't send the item shown
content: I like the fan for the white noise it makes.  The fan in the picture is the old model, which was what I wanted, but they actually sent the new model, which is much quieter and therefore not what I wanted.

title: noisy
content: This was supposed to be a quiet fan and is anything but that. We set it on a towel to try and dampen the nosie.

title: Useable for just over two months
content: Then it would have trouble starting, taking 5-10 minutes to start spinning.  Now it takes that long and is incredibly loud once it does spin.

title: A waste of Money
content: After 30 days of use the fan stopped working ~ motor quit.  Some things I guess are better purchased in a brick and mortar ~ I don"t blame Amazon so much but I do know I will not be buying any more fans online.  Piece of junk with the Honeywell name on it.

title: Lasts less then a year.
content: I have an old, large version of this Honeywell fan that has lasted at least 10 years. These smaller ones tend to last about a year. Replacing every 12 months is not my idea of a simple electronic product.

title: american fan no use in the uk
content: this fan is for the usa market and can not be used in the uk - so was a complete waste of money

title: Moves a lot of air (Update: Broke in 6 months)
content: It was a little larger than I anticipated.  I wanted to place it on my nightstand because I like the noise and a light amount of air moving.  Its low setting puts out too much air and it takes a lot of space on the nightstand.

title: Died after 4 months
content: This product was completely dead after 4 month. Honeywell wants me to pay to ship it to them for warranty support. It would cost more to ship it than the cost of the unit. Terrible product and equally as terrible customer service.

title: It's false advertising... nothing "turbo" about it
content: I've bought many of the older models of this fan... for different rooms in the house and for other people.  Also bought numerous over the years because they tended to die after a couple years (not surprising with my daily use).  Now however, this new model is trash. Complete garbage.  Will never buy another one of these again.  The main problem is that the power is gone.  There is nothing "turbo" at all about these fans... they need to remove that term because it makes the product all that much more absurd.

title: Fan blows
content: Lasted less than a year... same price at Home Depot and they would have accepted a return.  Don't get it - it is inexpensive, but to have to keep buying them - hassle.

title: I believe I wrote a glowing review after receiving this fan....but here is rest of story
content: I have had the fan about  2-3 days......Today, when I went to adjust the tilt of it,  the whole fan blade (the round part)  just snapped off from the base, and a bunch of the plastic pieces turned to broken tiny pieces.....which I gathered up and put in a bag......THIS FAN IS NOW a Worthless pile of pieces.....I would not recommend any HONEYWELL fan  (at least from Amazon--I don't know how this fan was stored or how long it has sat around, which could have affected this).......BUYER BEWARE!!!!

title: This works well until it doesn't and the warranty is a joke.
content: Bought his less than a year ago and it failed. I went to their 1 Year Warranty document which tells me to ship it to them (my cost) along with $10 for their handling, shipping and BS costs.

title: I should have read the description more carefully.
content: I cannot sleep in a completely silent room- I need the strong whir of a fan to fall asleep and stay asleep.  Having purchased this product before, I ordered without reading the claim that this fan is 25% quieter.  Even on the high setting, I can plainly hear my husband's heavy breathing, the birds outside my window at dawn, and traffic from the street outside our house.  Plugging the fan in was a complete disappointment, but that's my fault.

title: WEAK
content: This fan leaves a lot to be desired. Even on the high setting it is not powerful at all. I do not recommend this product.

title: NOT Actually a HONEYWELL Fan.
content: This  fan is not actually made by Honeywell.  If you try to return a defective fan, like mine that stopped working after 4 weeks.  Honeywell will do nothing for you.  You have to contact KAZ at the number on the label of the fan.

title: not worth it.
content: We purchased this in December and it has already quit working.

title: A Total Waste
content: Little fan little power. It will not cool a room as stated. Used mine for about 3 days placing it in different places. Finally gave up and just used my pedestal fans. I should have returned mine. Maybe I'll donate it.

title: Not reliable low air output for noise level
content: I purchased two of these, one is still working but the first died after 12 days of use.  I expected a bit more air flow for the noise ratio.  I like the look of them but wouldn't buy another one.

title: Only Lasted a few months...
content: Only Lasted a few months... almost 3 to be exact. Worked good the first month after that it started making a different noise but was still moving air as expected. Tonight when i turned it on the blades were at a crawl... turn off... turn back on dead with a faint humming.

title: Wabble noise
content: I bought this fan for some CLEAN white noise while I sleep. I literally got so angry in the middle of the night that I through it across the room. It makes all kinds of funny random noises, and sounds like the blades are wobbling inside. Tried to put a padded surface underneath it to lower to noise, but it still drove me crazy.

title: Fan stand is worthless and defective
content: I had this fan for 6 months before the stand that holds the actual fan broke complete apart on both sides where it attaches to the fan. The actual fan works great and is quiet and moves the air sufficiently. Once mine broke, I researched the issue about the defective stand and I found where other buyers of this wrote about the same issue. It is even on Honeywell's own site from customers that have complained to them about the defective stand too. Since Honeywell covers the product for year, I am able to send it back to them for a replacement. Because of the size and weight of the box, it cost over $13 for shipping to return it for warranty replacement. I would not recommend this fan.

title: Not a quality fan
content: This Honeywell fan died after 4 months of use which seems to be way to short of a life expectancy..

title: It broke after less than a year.
content: I expected something I spend 20 bucks on to last at least 2 or 3 years! But to break one day without any reason after a little under a Year is a complete waste of money! I will never buy another Honeywell product again and neither should you.

title: READ BEFORE YOU BUY
content: In march of 2008 I bought 4 of the Honeywell HT800 Super Turbo High Performance Fan, Black and they were very good for the price. In fact two gave out in 2012 so they were incredibly good considering that I kept them on just about all the time. When the two gave out I started considering buying them again since there so good. I then went to the amazon page and saw that that specific model was no longer being made but the upgrade, the HT-900 was the new replacement so without delay I went ahead and bought two October of last year. A little less than a month later the first fan gave out. I wrote to the company which was called Helen of Troy and they took their time in answering. After explaining what had happened they told me to return the fan through the  ail and they would replace it. When I got to the post office I was told that the shipping would cost just as much as buying a brand new fan. So either I could buy a new fan or mail them the bad one, wait a couple of weeks for them process it and then send me a new one which may or may not work. I wrote back explaining the situation and this is is what they wrote back:

title: Hardly Used
content: I got this fan so I could use it in my room at night. After I purchased the fan in August 2013, I used it for the first few weeks. My roommate felt that it was too cold, so I stopped using it all together. A few days ago (it is now January 2014), I realized that I can now use it again since my roommate relocated to another room. When I plugged it back in, it was working fine until I decided to use it this morning and it refused to turn on. I tried different plugs - nothing. It is really unfortunate because I feel like I hardly had time to "break it in" before it broke down. I would definitely not recommend this product.

title: Quit working after 1 week.
content: Quit working after 1 week. It didnt burn up, It just slows to a crawl, then eventually stops and humms. no reason I can see nothing is caught in it.

title: Didn't last very long.
content: This worked fine while it worked, but it lasted 3-4 months and now doesn't spin. No apparently damage, and the engine hums, just no motion of the blade, so no air moving.

title: Broken
content: I have several small Honeywell fans, but this one doesn't work. We've bought several that look just like this but they are black and we haven't had any trouble. Not sure if we just got a bad one or what..

title: Small table fan
content: We returned this item because it was obvious from the first glance that it would be impossible to take apart in order to clean the blades.

title: broke after 2 months
content: I used this at night for the sound and to cool us off at night.  It broke right after 2 months of use.  Ridiculous! I have cheaper fans that have lasted years and this broke so quickly.  Do not buy!

title: Does not work after 2 months
content: Bought this to help distribute the hot air from my wood burning stove.  It worked great for 2 months then would not start up even though the motor was running, the blades would not turn.  Used a file to try to turn the blades and finally they started.  Well the next day when I turned it on again in the morning it was a no go.  My husband blew it out thinking maybe dust had gotten into it and it worked for another couple days and quit again.  Used a file to get it going and am afraid to turn it off.  I will send this thing back, to bad it is quiet and moves the air.

title: Dead in less than two months
content: Previuos model lasted several years. Turned it on tonight and it would not turn.

title: kinda crappy
content: the first one died after 6 weeks.

reviewer: Some guy who buys stuff on amazon
title: Caution!  Do not leave this fan on unattended due to fire hazard!
content: I got this fan from amazon in June of this year.  The fan worked well and I had no issues until the other day I was suddenly overcome by a strong odor of burning plastic.  I was sure something was on fire somewhere so I evacuated everyone from the house and went back in to try and find the source before calling the fire department.  The fan was releasing a small amount of smoke and an overwhelming odor.  All electrical products can fail, this was a reminder to not be so complacent and to not leave items running unattended. I would regularly leave this fan on when not home and am very thankful it finally failed when I was home to unplug it.

title: Disappointing
content: I had one of these Honeywells a few years back, and it was great fan.  This one was decent for a few months, not as strong as past productions, but then the stand cracked!  Reading other reviews, seems the same issue has been experienced.  Why is Honeywell still selling this thing.  1 year warranty on $30 that would cost $15 to ship back.  Not worth the time to get a replacement.  A refund would have been fair.  Worth the time to warn others not to buy this.  Also, bought a larger HF910.  Avoid that model as well, plastic practically disintegrated in a few months, Tossed that one after 3 months.  Disappointed with Honeywell.

title: Stopped Working
content: After about a month of use the fan froze up and stopped functioning. The previous fan had the same issue, but lasted three years. Not so lucky this time. Returned.

title: Do not buy, cheap plastic hinges
content: Well, got it from UPS today, opened it up and the hinges were broken on arrival.

title: No improvement over 20 years, they've digressed.
content: This fan is a piece of junk when compared to the older version. I had on of these in college, inherited from my brother and it lasted for five years running every night. However, this new on has not even lasted 6 months with an average usage of every other night for 6-8 hours. I'm not planning on buying another unless the quality is restored to  the level of their previous fans made in the 90's and early 2000's, not this waste of disposable rubbish.

title: Worked well, while it worked.
content: Worked for 3 months without an issue.  Ran it maybe 6-8 hours a day.  Stopped working suddenly.  Would expect even a cheap fan to last longer than that.

title: FLIMSY
content: I purchased this fan July 2013 for my small studio apartment.  It worked great for the first summer.  No complaints.  I recently got it out of storage.  FYI I stored it in it's original box with original packaging.  Placed it on a small stool to circulate air at a higher level.  It was accidentally knocked over and snapped right off it's base.  It cannot be repaired.  It is a useless apiece of junk now.  So disappointed.  Honeywell used to be a reliable name brand.

title: Terribly Strong Chemical Offgassing!
content: Will be returning this item hoping the overwhelmingly strong chemical odor that I inhaled from it wasn't harmful.  It may be "25% quieter," but it's 100% unwelcome due to its horrid chemical stink.

title: This thing sucks
content: Just a few weeks after I bought it, the fan stopped working. Now the fan takes a few minutes to turn on before working properly and will sometimes just stop working out of nowhere. Thanks for nothing.

title: Not made by Honeywell
content: Worst fan ever.  Loud.  Vibrates like crazy.  Won't stay in one spot.  Cheap, cheap, cheap.  Made in China of course.  Don't waste your money on a wobbly plastic fan, buy a quality fan with metal blades (like a patton) and it will last forever.

title: Not As Described, in a crucial detail
content: I bought two of these because the product was explicitly described on Amazon as "easily cleaned" by means of a "detachable grill."  In fact, the grill is NOT detachable, so anyone with dust allergies should avoid it.  The product was falsely described.

title: Ran for an hour and then died
content: Wow. Decided to try this air circulator because 5-star reviews outnumbered 1-stars. Bought a Vornado 530 at around the same time to compare in two different rooms. I've been wanting to experiment with raising the thermostat but using air circulators to offset the heat (and hopefully save a little energy and money on my utility bill). Have had the Vornado a week and it is going strong and doing the job. I raise the thermostat to 77 and run this baby and feel as cool in my living room as if it were 72 or 73. The Honeywell came today. I was surprised that it was so much bigger and clunkier despite being cheaper and weaker, but I plugged it in in my 10X10 home office, and it worked fine. Turned it off, went on errands, came back two hours later, and the fan was dead. Dead. Dead. It is going back in the box and back to Amazon. Vornado has my business. I now know the extra expense is worth it. This Honeywell fan literally ran for one hour. I'm glad some folks have had a good experience with this air circulator, but not me.

title: broken hinge
content: I used the fan for less than a week and the hinge broke. Never will I buy another Honeywell product ever again.

title: Arrived Broken
content: I had read several reviews saying that the quality of Honeywell's products is on the decline. Well this product arrived broken right out of the box. Both shipping box and product box were intact, so no sign of rough handling. One of the fan blades was broken off right out of the box. Cheap flimsy plastic. I'm not willing to give them another chance since other reviewers have experienced similar shoddy workmanship.

title: Useless
content: The pivots on this fan have never worked so you have no flexibility with where you can point the fan.  And it you want to return the fan - you have to pay to return it AND there is a "warranty fee".  Quite the scam Honeywell has going on here.

title: I hate it
content: Too loud

title: Disapointing
content: I live in the desert.  Fans are a must.  When I saw these I thought "Honeywell", that's a good brand so ordered three of these the end of January.  The first one stopped working about four weeks in.  There can be a lemon in any group but the second one died this morning.  I got it going again but one speed only which means it won't last much longer.  It is either a problem with the on/off switch or the motor, I am not sure which but would advise to no buy this one.

title: Fan works fine-- but so weak!
content: yeah, well. for its price and quality-- the plastic hinges that holds the fan is VERY weak. As long as you are extra careful you should be fine.

title: No longevity
content: If I'd have reviewed this a few weeks ago I might have given it 4 or maybe 5 stars. As it is...it's lucky to have received 1 only because it didn't break practically out of the box and I can't rate any lower. Sure it did what is expected at first. For the last few weeks though it has times when it slows down.sometimes to a humming standstill. Not what I'd expect after only 2 months. I can not recommend this product unless you just want a few months of perfect fan function and then trash it and get another.

title: I bought Two and both broke w/in 6 months
content: ABSOLUTE GARBAGE.  I had some old fans that looked like this that lasted 4-5 years before they went out.  These fans both died within 6 months of ownership.  Now I have two fans that don't work. Thanks for selling out, Honeywell.

title: It is too noisy
content: It is too noisy for me in the office but I have I will keep it.

title: nothing turbo about this fan
content: I have paid less for a fan that pushed more air. If you are standing one foot from the fan you can barely feel any air being pushed at you.

title: JUNK
content: Three months and it froze up. DO NOT BUY!

title: Why did I get the used one?
content: The shipping on this item was super fast, which is good for those who live in freakin hot states.

title: Stopped working.
content: After only 9 months of light use, the fan blade no longer spins. I can hear the electronic pulse humming inside of the item, but apparently the motor has failed. I took extremely good care of the fan, and only used it on my desk. Additionally, I see in the reviews that other customers have shared a similar story. In conclusion, then, I strongly recommend that you avoid this product.

title: 1 Year LifeSpan
content: Exactly what I thought it was. Completely satisfied.

title: Good if you don't mind the noise and don't want a fan with a low "Gentle" setting.
content: Well it does it's job.. However, too noisy for the lowest setting and too fast for the lowest setting. It's like it goes from really fast to A little faster then that to a lot faster and loud.

title: This fan is garbage. the fan part broke off of it's stand ...
content: This fan is garbage. the fan part broke off of it's stand after only 6 months because it is held together by a very weak ring of plastic at both ends.

title: Total garbage. May-beg of July
content: The fan motor already died. Total garbage. May-beg of July. Total crap.  BUYER BEWARE

title: Bracket / Stand Broke after 1 year
content: The frame broke at the pivot points after about a year. I used this in my office. It was not moved around much or even tilted often. The plastic is very weak near the hinges. The fan is of fair quality. Moves a reasonable amount of air but isn't super quiet doing it.

title: Much larger than I thought it would be. I ...
content: Much larger than I thought it would be. I was expecting a small desk fan about the size of my hand. This fan is actually about the size of a basketball.

title: Three Stars
content: Not useful if you're looking for background white noise for sleeping.

title: Not the best, does its job in a small room, not noisy
content: I purchased this product and the great part was that I received it the same day.  The product is good its just not great. It blows just for a certain distance not really for a complete room.  Cannot compare with Vornado which can blow up to 2 rooms. The upside is that it does not make as much noise as the Vornado would.

title: Don't waste your money
content: Extremely small, only a little over 12 inches wide, and weak. The highest setting is very weak. Don't waste your money. The only thing this is good for is a desk.

title: Works OK but breaks extremely easily
content: The swivel mounts where the base meets the fan are incredibly weak. The slightest fall and the fan is broken, and it's not especially stable. I had a larger one of the same design and the same thing happened.  Sooner or later they tip over and break, and then you can tape them back together again with strapping tape, but the fan won't swivel up and down anymore.

title: Three Stars
content: This fan was ok until it stopped working after about six months.

title: Good not Great Fan
content: This fan is priced right and lightweight. Definitely works if you have to have white noise to fall asleep. It doesn't provide much in the way of cool air though. Great to bring if you are staying overnight with family or friends but not to cool a room.

title: Rather disappointed
content: We had one of these and it blew wonderful but in ordering this one, it's certainly lacking in power. I'm giving it 3 stars for just working.

title: This fan is super quiet -- which is the exact opposite of what ...
content: This fan is super quiet -- which is the exact opposite of what I was looking for.

title: It was a great fan for almost 2 years
content: I really loved this fan when I bought it, and it does the job—just loud enough to serve as white noise, but not loud enough to be annoying. It doesn't rattle like some other fans, though it will if its on an even slightly uneven hardwood floor, you can adjust until it doesn't. The problem is that the motor seems to be burning out now, just under 2 years after purchase. It sometimes stops spinning or needs to be plugged in and on for a minute or two before it'll kick into gear.

title: Good for the price
content: Ok fan, not great but will move air around on the high setting. I am using this fan while playing drums with my band. I keep it on the highest setting aimed right up at me and it does an adequate job. When it dies I will invest a few more bucks to step up the air movement in a bigger fan.

title: Three Stars
content: Good product for the money

title: USED to be good
content: I own the older model of this fan and have used it nightly for over 5 years and across several states with no issues. I loved it. So when I bought this fan I thought it would be as good as it's predecessor. Not a chance. It stopped working after two weeks, and the only way to get it started was to remove the front grill and crank start it like an old biplane! Finally it gave in today, just 3 and a half months after I started using it the blades will no longer spin. And why don't I send it back? Factor the cost of shipping this fan (what Honeywell charges to ship from their site) $14.87, plus the $10 processing cost, and I'm $10 over the cost of a new one. I'm not buying Honeywell again.

title: Cheap- powerful
content: The stand broke.... Cheap.  The fan. Poweful

title: Three Stars
content: Very very very quiet fan, can NOT be used for "white noise" or for sleeping purposes.

title: Production change
content: I'm a little disappointed.  I have an earlier version of this fan.  It blows ridiculously fast and cool.  This new version is quiet, slow and somewhat cool.  It gets the job done; just not like the earlier version.

title: Not for long term use
content: First one burnt out on me

title: ... clean the inside of the blades which can be annoying but blows good air in my
content: Hard to clean the inside of the blades which can be annoying but blows good air in my bathroom

title: I do like how quiet it is
content: the fan is ok, smaller than I thought; for a turbo high is not very high speed; I do like how quiet it is; the price was great thou. Thank you, Sharon / LaPorte, IN

title: Fan works just fine. You can tell it's been used and it's ...
content: Fan works just fine. You can tell it's been used and it's probably been left on for long periods of time because the engine is noticeably weaker than the ones my coworkers around me have. That said, the seller was honest enough about the product, but honestly if you're looking for something to create a little white noise, it might be worth spending the extra $5 to get the new one :-)

title: A nice quite fan.
content: If you are looking for white noise this is NOT fo you. As a air mover it's fine. Small and portable.

title: This fan is pretty terrible and poorly designed
content: This fan is pretty terrible and poorly designed.  It made a loud rattle sound from the very beginning.  Would not buy it again and sorry I am too late to return it.

title: Semi-quiet - not for white noise use, but strong air movement
content: This moved a decent amount of air...however, I was shopping for a noise maker and this just wasn't loud enough. It wasn't super quiet, you can definitely hear it's running, but not enough to cancel any noise out.

title: It looks pretty old! I believe It's been opened
content: It looks pretty old! I believe It's been opened! I paid for a new one though. However, the fan works well!

title: Not Satisfied
content: I bought these to help block out noise for children when they sleep (I'm a child care provider).  These are not very strong fans and don't push the air very far like other fans. Although providing white noise is not their aim, I was hoping something with "turboforce" in the name would work, but unfortunately I'm not satisfied with the performance of these fans, even just as something that moves air around.

title: Just okay
content: Does the job, but this is a cheaply made fan.

title: Three Stars
content: A little disappointed.  But, for the price it serves its purpose.

title: it doesnt blow enough air around to be that useful and its highest setting is basically tornado mode
content: On its lowest and medium setting, it doesnt blow enough air around to be that useful and its highest setting is basically tornado mode. It works if you need a little circulation or a whole heck of a lot.

title: Product Failure, Beware!!!!
content: The motor on this fan died only 5 months after i purchased it. Amazon refused to replace it, claiming i must go through manufacturer. I got a run around from Honeywell. Then i was told i would have to pay shipping and this amounted to $30.00 dollars. I only paid $43.00 This makes it not worth it. Do not buy this product!!!!!

title: Weak
content: If you are looking for a powerful fan that provides some white noise then look somewhere else.  It is just a weak little fan but for the low price I guess I can't complain.  I bought this fan because I read a review that said it was good for white noise.  That person must have super sonic hearing because I thought it was really quite even on high.

title: Three Stars
content: Very very small.

title: Please read
content: it worked perfectly for a few months only; now I have to forcefully tap it hard for the fan to kick-start which it seldom does. Unfortunately it's too late to return it so I ordered a new one with the hope that it will last me atleast an year and I get the value of price paid. Will greatly appreciate if the company replaces it for free.

title: My last Honeywell Turbo Fan had more power than this ...
content: My last Honeywell Turbo Fan had more  power than this.  Would really only use this for white noise...not much for moving air around.  For the little air it moves, it sure makes enough noise....

title: Three Stars
content: Didn't realized they made it quieter. That's the purpose of my purchase

title: Three Stars
content: Great to start off, however, it slowly starts to spin more and more slowly as time goes on.

title: Three Stars
content: work well, but needed something a little bigger

title: Weak, but at least it's quiet.
content: As an owner of 2 "vornado" fans, I knew this one wouldn't be quite as good... but illustrations on the box made me wonder if they copied the vornado design... In short, I could immediately tell that was an incorrect theory. This is a VERY basic fan... even on the highest setting, the air generated feels fairly week. That said, it is fairly quiet, so that's a plus. If you need it for a small personal space, it's adequate. But this definitely won't circulate air in a medium sized room.

title: Lack of quality control

Since we put it in the babies room and I was nursing him prior to putting him to bed, this was less than soothing and it was 79 in the room and our air conditioner was broken. Good thing my hubby is handy and tightened a whole bunch of screws the next day. I expected better quality based on the reviews. I felt bad for my little in that room though. Once we fixed the screws it worked fine.

It is fairly powerful on the highest setting but the lowest setting seems to be a little too weak. After a few weeks of moderate to heavy use it does make a noise that it didn't upon first opening. The noise is hard to describe but almost a clicking/hissing noise but overtime I have stopped noticing it.

title: Would be great if they lasted longer
content: So I am really torn between 3 and 4 stars on this fan.  The fan is great in the fact that for the size it moves a good amount of air and the newer models are pretty quiet even on full.  I have a bulldog that loves to go lay in front of the fan when she is hot so this is the perfect size to suit her needs and I generally leave it running most of the summer season.  With how much I like how well this fan performs the glaring issue I have with them is longevity.  I have been using this model of fan for years but the problem is I pretty much have to buy a new one every year.  As they age the fan does get louder and eventually wont have enough power to start spinning on its own but will start moving if you were to stick something through the grates and poke the blades.  I have a feeling if it were possible to take the front off and clean the blades it may last longer.

title: This is a "spot" fan, not a "flood"
content: This fan has a very narrow angle of ventilation. If you're on the outside of a 30 degrees arc from the center of the fan, you won't feel anything. I would prefer a wider area of wind. Otherwise it makes decent wind for a very, very small space.

What leading competition?  A jet aircraft?  This fan is loud as hell, and needs a slower setting.  Cheap construction and an annoying base that can only aim straight or upward.  It's fine if you need some air circulation but it's a bit unwieldy and loud for anything else.  It just needs a lower setting to be a more versatile product.

title: Big fan ... Needs some improvements in design.
content: This is a big fan; When you open the box, you feel it is a powerful fan, but when you turn it on, you feel like... hummm... is there any higher speed option that I missed. It is slightly bigger than a standard soccer ball. it looks big, but its maximum wind speed does not match to its size. The kind of breeze that hits your face while travelling at 10-15 miles per hour in a car hits you at its maximum speed. I have seen even smaller fan with powerful motor giving better breeze than this fan. I can bet that a normal hair dryer can give you stronger breeze (if we ignore area). When I turned it ON, I was slightly disappointed, but I think in this price it is a decent deal. if you are sweating it can dry you in 15 to 20 mins. Best part is that you won't get headache or fall sick because of direct breeze on your face at this speed. It is quite silent because it is slow. Also, IT DOES NOT TURN 360 degree (just straight and top - 90 degree angle of rotation is allowed). I just bought it because honeywell is a trusted brand, and lot of people already bought it and have given good reviews. I hope it will accompany me for at least 2-3 years. Last, if you are thinking of buying it for your office desk, then I would suggest you to buy a smaller one. It will occupy lot of space on your desk and won't look good. Expectations about speed may vary from person to person; to me it is 10 to 20% slow, which is not a huge disappointment overall. Honeywell can make it perfect by improving speed little bit and increasing range of angle of tilt by -40 to 90 (currently it is 0 to 90) degrees.

title: Not a tornado but not quiet...
content: Fan works just like a fan but for all the reviews that said this was quiet or usable in a professional office environment, it's not.  There is no way you can put this on your desk in a quiet office and it not sound like a wind tunnel.  Yes, it works but it's too big for a desk top, it can be heard by fellow cube-farmers and has to be turned off for conference call/video conferencing (even on the low speed).  For a regular fan or white noise at night while sleeping, it should work just fine. .

It's about 10 inches in diameter and stands 11 inches tall. Its output is minimal -- enough to move a little air at night, but not by any means TurboForce. It's quiet, which is a plus if you're going to use it in a bedroom. We wanted a fan to move air conditioning around the house, the way our other Honeywell does. The photo makes this fan look huge, but I should have read the dimensions before buying. I thought $10 was way too reasonable a price!

content: Well, this product is fine it does what is supposed to. Compact, good looking works with cable connected on outlet, and gives you some air thru a smaller fan. My only complaint is I was expecting more air from this fan for the brand and some reviews but it didn't cut it for me. Good but not wow. Again Mixed Feelings with this one.

title: Nice Personal Fan
content: I like the size of the fan and the fact that it can rotate. This is not a bad fan to invest in however I do wish it was a little more powerful (it is somewhat difficult to tell what modes you are in at times- they seem similar).

title: Three Stars
content: Hoped it would be a lot more powerful...

title: Three Stars
content: the switch is hard to get at

title: Disposable
content: Had a plastic stink to it for a month, but now is okay.  The three speed switch seems to be flimsy; you can feel it twisting when you use it.  The thing is I have a full size Patton fan and have used it for 15 years now.  It is GREAT.  Why are all the table top fans such disposable junk?

title: This is a great fan. I bought it to use in my ...
content: This is a great fan. I bought it to use in my kitchen and it's perfect for cooling things down when the room gets hot and humid. It's almost silent too, which is nice since I have a radio playing nearby all the time.

title: Not loud enough for white noise
content: I guess the volume is good that it's quiet but we wanted it more for white noise than an actual fan, so we wish it wasn't as quiet!

title: I was looking for a desk fan and this is ...
content: I was looking for a desk fan and this is not right for that. It is too big and too powerful for a desk.  It has a lot of power for a small fan.

title: Ehhhh, it's okay for our small office. We ...
content: Ehhhh, it's okay for our small office. We found larger fans at a cheaper price. BUT this is ok for a small office.

title: Not as powerful and loud as my previous fans of ...
content: Not as powerful and loud as my previous fans of the same make and model.  I use mine for noise while I sleep and this one isn't loud enough.  I bought the same model as I had because I thought I thought it would sound the same.  Honeywell must be buying the motors from a different Chinese factory.

title: Good Fan
content: Good Fan but not for the night stand on low!

title: 3rd time buying this fan
content: This is the third time I've bought this fan. I use it as a bed side fan since I sleep hot.  It wears out though after a year and half or so from daily use.  It's reallg hard to clean that's why I only give it 3 stars.

title: Not bad for 15 dollars
content: Bought this in August of 2014. After 2 years of average use, meaning 4-6 hours 5 days a week for about 6  months out of the year it died. Not bad for 15 dollars. It's fairly quiet on the 1st and 2nd setting but can be a bit loud on the 3rd setting. Air movement wise, it will move your hair around a bit or across your face but not strong enough to blow your hair all the way back. This is by no means a super cooler. I would say it's meant more as something to keep near your desk or my your bedside.

title: Needs more power
content: Works fine, just not enough power.

title: It's ok.
content: Pros:

title: No easy to clean
content: Good little fan. Just wish it could be dissembled for cleaning.

title: Frustrating at best, to have the fan rotate like that
content: Well it does what a fan is supposed to do, move air.

title: Three Stars
content: Louder than expected.

title: Three Stars
content: it works ok but the force of the air isn't what I expected.

title: oo small, go to the next size to take care of a room.
content: Too small, go to the next size to take care of a room.

title: ... of these little Honeywell fans and they are all great..
content: I have several of these little Honeywell fans and they are all great...this is the first one I've purchased online &/or through Amazon. It is not nearly as powerful as the other fans I have, although it is quieter. If you are looking for a small powerful fan, I do not recommend this product.

title: Three Stars
content: Good fan. Wish it was a little more powerful.

title: it blows air fine and doesn't make too much noise
content: it blows air fine and doesn't make too much noise, but the base is flimsy and tips up whenever you touch it.  the switch is tiny, you need to hold the fan with one hand and work the switch with the other.

title: I bought it to replace a loud 20" box fan that is a couple years old and kinda dirty. This is about as loud as the box ...
content: Not very quiet, doesn't really move as much air as I hoped.  I bought it to replace a loud 20" box fan that is a couple years old and kinda dirty.  This is about as loud as the box fan and doesn't move as much air.  I can tolerate the noise (wife doesn't like it as much), but I am disappointed that it doesn't move more air...

title: Three Stars
content: Very small

title: Three Stars
content: Not a lot of power behind this. I wouldn't buy another one.

title: Great small fan
content: Great small fan. It is not as fast as the previous one I bought. Not sure why that is.

title: Great Product
content: Made well and works great. I

title: Broke down after 3 months of constant use
content: The first one broke after constant use of 3 months. Not sure this is to be expected?

title: Small
content: A lot smaller than I thought but guess that was my fault for not paying attention to the measurements  It's just ok for air circulation. .

title: Well pleased.
content: As advertised.Well pleased.

title: Three Stars
content: Should have chose the tall osillating one!

title: Missing Cap, but Fan Works Well
content: The fan works fine. It is missing the black cap that goes over the screw on the right side of fan. It is too much of a hassle to replace the fan for something that is cosmetic.

title: Decent
content: This fan is not as loud as the previous models.  I have it on for background noise at night, so I just keep it on a higher setting to get more noise out.  It does not seem to be as quality as the previous model.  It likes to whir and make motor noise for the first few minutes it is on and then it goes away.

title: Broke after 1 year and 11 months.
content: Worked well while it did... then started taking longer and longer to start up. I guess for $13 you can't expect much.

title: These are nice, but they only tilt up
content: These are nice, but they only tilt up, not down. You can aim them from 90 degrees (pointing straight) to 0 degrees (pointing straight up), but you can't point them greater than 90 degrees (pointing down) in any way. You would have to prop the back up the base up on a book or something to aim it down. It has 3 speeds and is pretty strong. This fan is a bit noisy though. Not like clatter clatter bang bang or anything, but it is loud.

title: ok for office or tiny, tiny room
content: The fan would be well suited to cubicle use.  It's too small for a room.  While it can be adjusted to blow upward - - all the way to straight up, it won't angle downward at all.

title: Good enough
content: It's a decent fan.  I have it wall mounted.  On high it blows sufficient air.  On low it's good for white noise.

title: Three Stars
content: Works. Well for size goo for small area.

title: Quiet, but weak.
content: Having purchased two of these fans (at the same time, mind you) I would say they are 3-4 stars at best.  The fans are a nice size and extremely light, the cord could be a tad longer but it's not bad.  Their best selling point is how amazingly quiet they are.  I have two of them running in the same space and you barely even notice them when standing right next to the pair.

title: Three Stars
content: they're big dust collectors and hard to clean

title: The smaller size and lightweight plastic made it easy to bring along for camping
content: The name suggests a turbo force, and it definitively does NOT live up of that name.  it's just a plain old fan.  The smaller size and lightweight plastic made it easy to bring along for camping.

title: Three Stars
content: It's okay, but wish it was more powerful

title: Not bad for the price
content: I've bought like five of these fans in the past. They don't last forever but they last a good long time for them being turned on almost 24/7 in our household. We even found a way to attach it to the wall which makes for more floor/counter space.

title: Fuses Come Loose In Shipping
content: I ordered three of these fans. Two of the three didn't work, right out of the box. I noticed that there is a fuse located in the plug so I pulled and tested them. I found the fuses good, and after I carefully re-seated them, the fans worked. If I had not had the one working fan, I would not have attempted to troubleshoot, I would have just returned them.

title: Three Stars
content: Makes clicking noises sometimes that are very annoying.

title: Three Stars
content: Not as strong as I thought it would be.

title: Three Stars
content: a

title: Hopefully just a short in the wire
content: After a few months it broke. I am going to try to get it fixed

title: not great.. I mean it points straight up so ...
content: The motor on this thing is a little under powered. I would expect that the high setting be medium and also you can't point the fan down which is what I needed to force air through my gas fireplace that doesn't have a recirculating fan. I had to take it apart and modify the mounts by drilling some holes to get it to point down.. not great.. I mean it points straight up so why not a little bit down past straight forward.. also it has a bad center of gravity the base is not great for the fan. Its an ok fan and it works pretty much but it could be a lot better with slight modification.

title: I love it.
content: meet my expectation. I love it.

title: Works Nicely But Switch A Bit Awkward To Get To
content: Fan works well and is quiet.  The tilt mechanism is very handy.  One minor glitch is that the switch on the back is a bit awkward to get to.  This would be a great product if the switch was on the front of the fan.

title: Three Stars
content: Ok

title: Not a really strong fan

title: ... bought this one because we had another and really liked them. The first one still works perfectly and ...
content: We bought this one because we had another and really liked them. The first one still works perfectly and it gets used about every night. The second one was used a few nights a week and agter about a year the fan starts out slow and then it will eventually start working. Thinking the motor is about to go out.

title: We like fans more for the sound and on level 3 ...
content: We like fans more for the sound and on level 3 the sound is OK but it's winter and it's cold here. So level one would be better for temperature, but the sound is very very low.  So we have the sound on at level 3 but it's cold all night.

title: Three Stars
content: Fantasic, fits in small space

title: Three Stars

title: Three Stars

title: quiet, light weight
content: It is quiet but in my opinion not a lot of airflow.  Light weight which is a plus.

title: Was great while it lasted
content: Used nightly for 14 months. Just quit working completely. Was great while it lasted.

title: Super quiet fan
content: We were looking for a fan for noise, and this fan is SUPER quiet. So if you're looking for an almost noiseless fan, this is it :)

title: Three Stars
content: It works okay

title: Not as described or expected
content: This is advertised as an 11" fan.  The only thing about this fan that is 11X11X6.5 is the box.  The fan is 10X9.5X6.  It is definitely NOT a Turbo Air Circulator in the true sense. Sure it circulates the air, but when you think of a TurboForce Air Circulator you get the impression by the description that you will get a huge rush of air that will flap the curtains and blow papers everywhere. That will never happen with a blade 3.5 inches long from the tip of the blade to the hub nor will it create a huge force of air with the blade angles and the rpm in which the fan turns. Its okay as a fan but not what I expected.

title: Three Stars
content: Its too quiet, which some may want. I didnt. Mt fault for not reading all the description

title: Very loud!
content: The box states "20% quieter" than a past model, but this thing is loud. I've had fans of this brand with no problem, so I wasn't expecting the noise. Even on the lowest setting, it sounds like I'm in an airplane with that engine hum. It is too loud to have in a professional office. I have it to replace my night fan and it sounds like a noise machine.

title: It was used mostly for white noise
content: It was ok for the white noise. It pretty much ran 24-7 - 365 with maybe a few days off when we traveled. It had a one year warranty ( which the terms seemed kinda crapy) and it died in 1 year and a month. I think it could have been a little louder for the noise but, all in all can't complain too much for the price. It did its job.

title: Not So Quiet
content: Performs as advertised, but simply not as quiet as expected.  I would go to a local store and try some side by side before buying again.  Somewhat disappointed.

title: We already have this fan in white and I was ...
content: We already have this fan in white and I was expecting the same quality. I've had it for about a month(for white noise) and now it makes an awful rattling sound over time.

title: Ok, but could use a lower low
content: Nothing particularly wrong with this fan other than low isn't low enough.

title: Three Stars
content: This little fan was pretty good, but burned out after 4 weeks of nightly use.

title: Average
content: Doesn't come with a mounting kit. I'm worried it will fall off the wall. Doesn't seem sturdy. Fan isn't as powerful as i hoped. It also can't swivel after its been mounted and only tilts in 1 direction.

title: BLOWS
content: BLOWS

title: Don't be fooled by the name
content: The fan is not as powerful as they make it sound

title: Thought I was going to save money but was not a good product. Go with the more expensive vornado type
content: Too loud. Ended up having to return it. Thought I was going to save money but was not a good product. Go with the more expensive vornado type fan

title: Three Stars
content: Its OK. Had a smaller version of this fan that actually moved more air. This one not so much

title: Design flaws, but good air flow
content: This fan definitely has a good air flow, but serious design flaws. The power switch is a total pain, you have to turn the fan around to be able to put switch where you want it comfortably. Major flaw is system they use for raising and lowering fan, instead of being able to just point it high or low depending on need, you are only able to put it in a few locking spots. Clicks in place, up or down, but lock spots are too few and too far apart, very annoying. Otherwise, so far so good, but next time I'll go back to a nice regulsr put it shere you want it number.

title: Litttle disappointed
content: Was hoping this fan would generate little more noise like the one I previously owned. Turn fan on when retiring for the day, like to have some noise in background while sleeping.  Wanted to send back and upgrade to another, but my husband said it was fine.  He never wants to return a thing.

title: Three Stars
content: it stopped working the next day!

title: Three Stars
content: Stopped working within a week.  Same product that can be found at Wal-Mart.

title: Three Stars
content: A little too quite for what we were looking for

title: Three Stars
content: Gift for my wife, just what she needed.

title: OK but will not last
content: Ok for limited use but if used daily, will not last more than a year.  The motor bearing sleeves are not the best quality and will wear out quickly.

title: Worked well while it lasted for 2 years then broke
content: It worked well while it lasted. After having it for two years it started squealing very loudly and now it does not work at all.

title: Three Stars
content: Could use a better speed switch.

title: A square deal
content: For the price, it's fine. It doesn't swivel (don't mind that) , but the compact size covers a small area. Needed it to help when A.C. conked out. Wish it were stronger.

title: Three Stars
content: Rattles.

title: an ok fan for budget minded buyer
content: They are not the strongest blowing fans, but i have 3 of the working together and it does the job

title: Quite, but doesn't seem to fit the term "turbo"
content: Works well as a quiet fan, but I don't see how it can be labeled "turbo". I bought it for white noise and only helps a little.

title: Not good hit and miss
content: Bought two and one doesn't blow. Loud enough. My husband and I sleep with both one on each side. It worked for like two days then it doesn't so I got a different fan.

title: Three Stars
content: nice and quiet

title: Three Stars
content: Rattles a lot. But I guess that is to be expected for the price.

title: Eh
content: This fan is alright. Considering it says "turbo force power" all over the box, it doesn't pack much power. I was expecting it to be much for powerful, the first and second setting will probably never be used unless you just want to hear the fan but don't want it to move air. If you're planning on pointing this directly at you while at a desk then it's a great deal, but don't expect it to move much air if you're more than 2 feet away.

title: Started making noises within two minutes
content: It was silent when I brought it out of the packaging and began to run it, but within two minutes of it running it began to hum, then a choppy propellor noise kicked in. Will have to see if i can make it a litttle better :/

title: OK fan, high expectations will leave you disappointed
content: This fan works fine and all, but it doesn't put out very much wind. In the end, it's a cheap little fan, and I uess that's what I was willing to pay for. Just don't expect to love this fan, unless all you wanted was the sound.

title: Low is a bit better. Is there a quiet fan out there anymore
content: It's ok, not as quiet as I thought. Has a low hum when running on medium setting. Low is a bit better. Is there a quiet fan out there anymore??? Vornado used to be but reviews on those aren't any better...oh well. It does move the air good though.

title: Three Stars
content: Bought for white noise but not strong enough to drown out noise.

title: Love it or Hate it.
content: If you are looking for a fan that you can't hear, this is your fan.  If your looking for a fan to use as noise to sleep with at night, this is NOT your fan.  It claims it's 25% quieter than the older version, I believe it's way better than 25%.  It also does not push any volume of air whatsoever.  When I turned it on for the first time, I thought I had it turned to 1,  It was actually on it's highest setting 3!

title: Its alright, not all that
content: I ordered 3 of these because i needed 3 fans at home but i usually only buy 20 inch fans not 11 inch ones but the reviews on this fan were pretty good with people making it sound like this fan is so powerful which it is not, its exactly what it is an 11 inch fan that dont feel like no turbo to my wife or me, i should have still ordered something bigger for when the temperatures start getting in the upper 80s and 90s and humid and we dont want to have the a.c. units blasting all day and night. I had a vornado the same size and that thing on high was as powerful as a 20 inch lasko fan, this one is not.

title: Three Stars
content: wish the speed was faster to blow harder.

title: Three Stars
content: I don't like that I can't turn the fans power down more.

title: Overall okay.
content: Small! And pretty quiet. We got the 11". Overall, decent. If you're looking for super powerful or noise blocking -- this is not your fan.

title: It's a fan
content: After buying this "air circulator" I came to find out its just a another fancy word for fan. It blows good air but doesn't really spread it around. It's more like a personal fan in my opinion

title: Fan noisy over time
content: Was great for a few months, but got noisy and is a minor bother now with the rattling....might have to drop kick it to the curb soon.

title: Three Stars
content: It's a little noisy for my taste but it gets the job done.

title: Pee Wee-900
content: It should be called The Pee Wee-900. I have a small fan at work that I turn on upon arrival and turn off when leaving. It is the same outside measurement as this one except the blades are larger. This Honeywell has such tiny blades that running it on high speed it barely moves air. I will keep it for my night stand next to my bed but, I wouldn't buy another one.

title: Horrible for white noise
content: The fan does a fair job and moving air for its size.  However, I purchased it to move and and provide some white noise while sleep at the station.  The new motor is weaker and quieter that previous models.

title: I used this in a server room in a cage ...
content: I used this in a server room in a cage where it is constantly on.  It lasted almost a year.  I am buying the 15 inch version of this model and hope to get a longer life from it.

title: Three Stars
content: Good quality but not as strong as expected

title: not impressed
content: its a fan, it blows, but a box fan would blow way more, the swivel action is only up 90 degrees, which is just silly, should swivel down also. .

title: not what I thought
content: thought it was smaller

title: Three Stars
content: I would like a more powerful fan. But works good.

title: Good fan, didn't last long
content: Well, I loved this fan...for about six months.  Then it died.  I would have given it more stars if it had lasted.

title: 25% quieter - but also 25% less powerful
content: This replace the same older model (basically).  This item says it is 25% quieter.  It is but I do not think it is because of blade design since it is probably 25% less powerful too. Confirmed by putting both next to each other. I would rather it make the noise it did before for a stronger fan, especially on high. Big disappointment.

title: I was really disappointed when it came to find that it only produces ...
content: Soo I have had this same fan but an older model for about 6 years. I used it to provide noise and air movement when I sleep but unfortunately I used it so much the motor finally gave out. So I ordered this one. I was really disappointed when it came to find that it only produces about 1/3 of the noise the older one did. This is probably a great selling point to a lot of people, but for me it wasn't. It was too quiet and I couldn't sleep. I ended up having to buy a separate noise machine to use in conjunction with this. My complaint might be your praise though. So if you are looking for a quiet one, this is good.

title: Three Stars
content: Not very strong

title: Just not strong blower!!
content: I have the older Honeywell fan that's white. It blows way way harder than this one!  This is its replacement! Not good if you need it to blow hard. But if you need it to blow soft this is your fan

title: Great fan. I was expecting a smaller fan
content: Great fan.  I was expecting a smaller fan.  Its to big for my desk at work.

title: Three Stars
content: I wish I t had rotation feature

title: Sleeping fan
content: I sleep with a fan and that's what I purchased this fan for. It was great at first but it only took 3 months for parts to shake loose and start making annoying noises. Wouldn't recommend it for a sleeping fan.

title: It was good and may have lasted longer if I had taken ...
content: I used this for about 6 months, mainly in my college dorm room. It worked really well until about the 6th month when I noticed the air wasn't as cold as it was when I first bought it. However, I did over use it, sometimes leaving it on for 6-12 hours straight. It was good and may have lasted longer if I had taken better care of it.

title: Lasts about 18 months.
content: I've owned a few of these. Two failed with no warning at about the 18 month mark with locked-up motors. I also have a competing 'V' brand model and it still acts brand new after nearly 4 years.

title: Not powerful
content: The quality is good, but this fan does not deserve a name with "turbo force" in it. Its highest setting generates a mild breeze. I was expecting a much needed intense stream of air, as I have a very warm bedroom. My last honeywell (bought 15 years ago) did this beautifully until it developed a rattle and got reassigned to the living room. The new fan is okay for next to a desk, so I'll keep it for that.

title: Too much of a good thing is
content: It's not kidding when it says TurboForce. This replaced a fan on my desk at work that died a slow and agonizing death. This guy puts out so much air, even on the lowest setting, that I have to turn it off and on repeatedly for my whole shift. Too much of a good thing is, I guess, too much!

title: Very Disappointed
content: I now own 3 of these fans. They work fine BUT almost impossible to clean. The first one I bought had visible screws and while cleaning was tedious, given price and performance it has been worth it. The last two I bought have really buried screws. I've yet been able to loosen them for cleaning. I mean seriously. I use a paint brush to try and get to all the dust and on the black one it's just ok. The newest white one will never look really clean, especially the blades. Very disappointed. Don't know why they changed the design. Either they think the fan will never get dirty [Ha], or they want you to just throw it away and buy a new one. I repeat - Very Disappointed.

title: Not the Honeywell desk fan you remember
content: If you've ever had one of these Honeywell desk fans over the past few years, you know they're a powerful desk fan - probably THE most powerful desk fan I've ever had. It was a bit noisy, but that was cool if you were using it in an office environment, because it was great at generating 'white' noise that filtered out a lot of the background mishmash of noise when you wanted to concentrate. If you took care of it - cleaned it occasionally, for the most part - it'd last forever, it seemed. Mine finally gave out after almost 5 years of nearly continuous use. Naturally, I immediately ordered another one on Amazon.

title: It is quiet but not really strong circulation
content: It is a nice looking fan, bigger than I expected but still very nice.  It is quiet but not really strong circulation, at least not enough for me.  I keep it on my work desk. I guess for very close personal space it is ok

title: Not Powerful
content: This fan is compact which is a plus. It seriously lacks air-moving power though which is not great at all.

title: Great product didn't last long
content: Received this product February 7th 2017 out of no where it stopped working on April 30th 2017. It's a great fan but the first one I brought from my local target 4 years ago is still running. So I'll never order one again.

title: Love hate relationship with this fan...
content: I got two of these fans. The first I really loved. It is loud enough to block out some noise, but quite enough not to to be annoying. It has 3 settings and is adjustable.The second fan I got makes a horrible rattling noise, so I can't use it. There is no way to take the fan apart, it seems to be glued together, so I can't fix it and cleaning it is going to be very difficult.

title: Loke my old wind machine better..
content: Cheap but ok. Loke my old wind machine better...

title: Not very powerful
