content: Disappointed that she doesn't know too many answers like Siri does

title: Three Stars
content: I'd like easier integration with my home automation (ISY/Insteon) as well as simplified voice commands for Skills.

title: But the speaker is great and so is the speed of answers
content: I though it did more probably my falt for not researching it. But the speaker is great and so is the speed of answers!

title: Three Stars
content: Needs more apps

title: I'm quite pleased with Alexa
content: I misplaced my iPad, so I asked Alexa where my it was, and she said,"Look under the couch."  I looked there 3 times, but it wasn't there!

title: Three Stars
content: It's ok, should have got google talk...☹️

title: Frustrations but still kind of a cool device
content: The Echo is a cool idea and it's not poorly executed, but I've been a little disappointed with a couple aspects of it.  First, Alexa's ability to find information - and find the *right* information - is vastly inferior to the Google tool on my phone.  I had hoped it would be about the same, but it's really not.  In about six weeks of ownership or so, there have been quite a few cases where I had to give up trying to ask Alexa something, and pull out my phone to ask Google instead.  When I described this to a friend, she said, "Maybe you should have gotten a Google Home instead".

title: I like the sound
content: I like the sound......speaker ability while playing songs. I am a bit disappointed that it isn't able to answer many questions that I ask. I also recently signed up for Amazon Unlimited but I can not find a way to re-program ' Alexa' to find music from there instead of my Spotify account.

title: I love Slacker and Accuradio
content: the lack of music website accessibility is really a bummer. I love Slacker and Accuradio, neither work with Echo.  Alexa also doesn't seem to know the answer to anything we ask her.

title: Three Stars
content: Comes up with some strange stuff

title: Could have spent the money on something else.
content: It's ok, but... Not worth the price. You HAVE to have prime membership to use it which I have so you're always paying for it. So far all I do is say good morning and good night. If you have to have everything out there then it's for you, as for me not loving it.

title: Echo not standalone for TV interface.
content: Can not run my TV without another piece of equipment to interface.  It finds my Nest thermostat but won't tell me what it's called so I can verbally adjust temp.

title: Promising but needs improvement
content: The Echo is a great concept with potential but she has a long way to go to match Suri. She doesn't search the web. There are many questions she can't answer and she doesn't allow you to place a filter on the music you play. I once got a number of expletives that came through in a song that I can't take back. She is in my kitchen and my kids can hear this. Amazon needs to do a better job of making her family friendly. The is still a lot of room for improvement.

title: No Portable after all....
content: Why not a battery? :(

title: Alexa has a narrow range of knowledge.
content: I found the Echo to be disappointing. The primary reason it was purchased was to ask questions of echo instead of going to Google. Echo cannot answer most of the questions we ask. Alexa seems to only know answers to celebrity and entertainment questions, but cannot answer questions related to sports or cooking.

title: Free Music . . . trial period
content: Wish I could get Alexa to play music from my I-phone music library.

title: Good for now, but will probably be better in the future :)
content: It's been nice for certain functions, but it is a little limited since it is still 'evolving' and growing going forward. I look forward to the expanded funcionality in the future though.

title: Three Stars
content: Alexa seems to know nothing about sports, and not a lot about anything.

title: It's a fun tool in smarthomes
content: It's a fun tool in smarthomes. In traditions home though, it's bag of tricks is pretty shallow. I want more from this machine

title: Does not know as much as I was hoping for ...
content: Does not know as much as I was hoping for... my phone Google knows way more things for me when asked.  Still learning it though.

title: Three Stars
content: can't control Directv !!!!

title: early stages in this product's lifecycle.
content: I have three issues with this device. First, the sound quality is just ok, and since I listen to a lot of Amazon music, that isn't acceptable.

title: Fun but very lacking in its ability to answer questions
content: It is fun to play with and the music is great.  However, the Alexa is very lacking in her ability to answer questions.  This is far behind Siri and Google's ability.  I searched and searched for skills to improve this capability.  All I found was some code I could download from GitHub and compile on Amazon Web Services.  I'm way to paranoid to do anything like that.  I assume/hope Amazon is working on Alexa's knowledge base.  As it is, I deducted two stars for this functionality along.  As it is, I'm glad I purchased this on Prime Day as I would not have been happy spending $179.

title: I'm like I said at this time I'm waiting to see ...
content: I'm kind of waiting at this time to see if the Echo can be up-dated faster. Many simple things a ask it comes back with no information. I'm like I said at this time I'm waiting to see how the information can increase.

title: So far its amazing..
content: Just received as a gift and learning about it.. So far its amazing... I'm sure it will be 5 stars when I can catch up to it.

title: Good device but not impressive
content: Good device but not impressive. The sound (music) is not better that my Oontz Angle. As an assistant is better and faster compared to Cortana but still lack a lot of functionality and integration with Windows 10. As a Bluetooth speaker, it does have better range that the Oontz.

title: Three Stars
content: Plays good music. Does no have many answers to questions. I was hoping it was more like google search

title: Questionable
content: I like the concept of the idea just frustrated that you need to learn the commands. You have to be specific when asking commands. Sure tells the time, stopwatch, tells day and weather but to truly use the full effect of the devise you need to know the exact wording..

title: I want to love it but I can't do some of the things ...
content: I want to love it but I can't do some of the things to get my music on it. It tells me to go somewhere else to know how. If you give it an old person like me set it up for them!!!!

title: Love some elements
content: Still getting acquainted. Love some elements.  Keeps reverting to a previous music choice when request for something totally different. Did complete voice order accurately.

title: Three Stars
content: It doesn't answer a lot of questions we ask, especially about sports!

title: I feel like its just one big marketing box
content: The Echo has a killer speaker!  Loud and clear.  Alexa however, doesn't seem to know much about anything other than the weather, tips for the day and everything you want to know about whats on sale at Amazon and everything Amazon.  I feel like its just one big marketing box.  You can't google anything.  You can't get any basic questions answered.  You have to install the 'skill's' for what seems like basic things.  the skills, you have to ask Alexa the right way to call the skill out, otherwise, it doesnt work.  Frustrating for its price.  I was super excited... but she doesn't seem to know much of anything like my family was anticipating.

title: The sound quality is great and I like the sleek clean look
content: The sound quality is great and I like the sleek clean look. My problem with it is (maybe it's something I have yet to discover) but I was under the impression I didn't need to have the Echo plugged in all time. I thought it was a charge and go. I wanted to easily grab it and move it from room to room, outside, etc. without having to plug it in everywhere.

title: Don't know if we keep it or send it back - "voice" issue and too much bass.
content: We purchased the ECHO as we had the ECHO DOT (given to us as a gift from family member) and have loved it.  So when I saw the ECHO come up on Prime Day I thought why not and upgrade to this in the main living area and move the DOT into another part of the house.  The issue has to do with hearing this unit.  I've googled and seen the info on "Alexia lower subwoofer" and "Alexia raise ...." - we've tried it for days and the volume and voice is so bassy we can't understand the majority of the ECHO.  I've read where others have same issues - but there doesn't seem to be any cure for this until I suppose Amazon updates the firm-ware.

title: Three Stars
content: Doesn't really do anything or serve any purpose like expected ..just a good speaker. Needs to improve

title: My time with Echo.
content: I need more instructions.  It doesn't answer a lot of our questions.

title: Didn't realize that communication with others requires them to possess ...
content: Didn't realize that communication with others requires them to possess a similar product, was under the impression that the communication was phone-based.

title: Three Stars

title: It's ok
content: It's ok

If you open up an app to anything u have to remember what it's called, for example "Alexa run so n so app..." I'd never remember every app I'd download to it, maps, restaurants n so on and so on. I end up googling everything regardless.

content: Our son and friends have Google Home and their devices provides much more knowledge than Alexa.  I do find the device to be handy though.

title: OK - but not really good
content: OK - but not really good. For example, it will give the general weather for the day in your location - but will not answer "when is the rain likely to begin?". Many popular songs are missing. It will improve over time - but it has a long ways to go. Also, if you are setting up Echo from a PC computer - the computer needs to be wi-fi capable - that is, the computer needs to have a wi-fi connection to your router - not an ether net only connection - luckily mine did. Excellent sound quality however.

title: I'm a tech-savvy millennial, yet this product frustrates me and does not live up to the hype.
content: I'm a tech-savvy millennial, yet this product frustrates me and does not live up to the hype.

title: It does everything I expected accept the sound quality is ...
content: It does everything I expected accept the sound quality is underwhelming, I also have Google home it's sound quality is acceptable.

title: Three Stars
content: Not as useful without Prime or prime music . Thought it  would be more iPhone friendly

title: Be aware it's not portable, must be plugged in
content: I bought this and mistakenly thought it was portable since I had seen one at a restaurant (we arrived early before most patrons). It was portable and the kids had a real kick so we jumped when the deals day came around. We like the music, reminder, timer, and weather feature but the rest is so-so. I'm sure we'll use more of it as we get use to it. Our biggest issue is portability, it can only go as far as the wire goes. We like music around the pool but it needs an electrical outlet.  As a result, the echo sits in a corner in the house. There is a battery pack that can be attached to the echo, BUT it's another $50 investment. I'm searching for a more reasonably priced battery pack but I wouldn't have ordered had I known.

title: Three Stars
content: Runs smaller than actual size.

title: Alexa is a Salesperson
content: For some reason it stop playing music I requested (John Denver) and tried to sell me Amazon plus @ 3.99 a month after the first month. I declined.  So what is that all about?

title: It is a nice gadget
content: It is a nice gadget and it recognize almost every simple phrase. For me it is a $200 voice controlled boombox/alarm clock. I have not used the Google one yet, so I can't compare them both.

title: Three Stars
content: does work with some of the apps listed

title: I returned this because it has to satay plugged in ...
content: I returned this because it has to satay plugged in. Wanted something that i could charge and take outside, so this did not work for me. Also, there is so many apps you have to download to use the echo. Wasn't a fan.

title: Three Stars
content: Got it as a gift from my grandma. I keep it unplugged because I don't trust it.

title: Don't overpay - needs instructions for utlimate use

Tries to play songs with the word "Dish' in them.  I am somewhat disappointed.  Hope it will get better as it learns my speech pattern.

content: I am disappointed that the Echo won't  connect the contact list and can only connect to those that have an echo.

content: It's fun, but it's difficult for it and me to communicate for questions more than simple tasks. And if it doesn't understand it just adds the phrases to the shopping list. It was developed to sell more Amazon products I suppose.

title: Good for some...Not for others.
content: I am not into a lot of the remote control things, or a lot of music that can be had.  If you are. this one is for you.  However, if you want to ask it questions, which will go to the internet and give you answers, then Google has this one beat, hands down!

title: Alexa orders figs...or does she?
content: I made a voice order for an item in my recent order history. Alexa said " based on your recent order history the item xyz is available for $32.00, shall I order it for you?" No mention of the change in vendor... just the reassurance that based on my order history.  Damn, not all Turkish fig vendors are created equal. I got unequal figs that I will regret every morning for the next 6 weeks... making me very wary of my new Echo any that friendly Alexa.

title: Dont buy refurbished!
content: I don't know if it is normal or reason that it was sent back does not connect to skills but half the time if that but funny to argue with about how stupid she is

title: A bit of a disappointment, but I'm hoping for better apps and software
content: The Echo is clearly a work in progress. It requires often stilted phrases, precisely spoken, to react properly - and as such, is less than the digital assistant suggested by the promotion. It was worth the sharply discounted Prime Week price, but barely. I don't know why I assumed that it would have an internal battery, but it doesn't - and its requirement for 15 volts DC at 1.5 amps means most external battery packs won't power it. There is one company purportedly selling a 6-hour battery for it, but it's no longer available.

title: Functionality is to limited and I can't tell it to ...
content: Functionality is to limited and I can't tell it to stream music directly from my phone.  I have to upload my music (First 250 songs for free) to the Alexia App in order to play my music.

title: I'm sure it's just me but I have been unable ...
content: I'm sure it's just me but I have been unable to get this setupset up. Going to wait for a day off and tackle it.

title: Sound Quality is Sub-par, stick with Dot and External Speaker
content: I received an Echo Dot for Christmas and have really enjoyed the Alexa features.  I have the Echo Dot connected to my JBL On Stage III which sounds great in my kitchen.  I thought the full size Amazon Echo would be an upgrade to my current setup for an all-in-one solution.

In spite of it, I am not so impressed with all the things that Echo/Alexa claims to do. The only thing that I found some use for is to play music. But my iPhone already does a good job at that. The other skills - there are too many constraints and limitations and friction to use them.

title: Alexa sound quality
content: While I truly enjoy being able to ask Alexa different questions on various subjects, my main focus is on classical music, especially those that emphasize famous violin musicians like Itzhak Perlman. Yehudi Menuhin, Joshua Bell or some of the compositions by famous composers like Beethoven, Mozart, Bruche, etc.  The sound comes out very tinny.  I have the same problem with pianos and flutes.  As a consequence, for the music I truly enjoy listening to, I  have to use my LP player to get the sound quality I enjoy.

title: Three Stars
content: OK but it needs a better speaker for music.

title: It's just okay.
content: We like it, but many times when we ask it questions it says "I don't understand" or something like that.  For instance, we asked Alexa to play a particular song on our Prime Amazon radio and she said 'I can't find that song' and I KNOW Daniel by Elton John has got to be on this service!  We are just not finding it that helpful except to ask it for the weather.

content: Not quite as useful as Siri or Cortana in terms of knowledge content but the integration with other smart devices is nice.

title: Three Stars

title: What Happened to Including a Remote???
content: I love the echo and Alexa, but the first time we got one it came with a remote, which is almost a necessity when playing music.  Alexa can't hear you when volume is medium to high, so you have to walk over and adjust it, if you have no remote.

title: The sound is not as good as my Bose
content: The sound is not as good as my Bose. I was hopping for $180 it would have at least been a similar quality. Alexa side is pretty good but sometimes she only responds with very specific words even if your saying the same. It will try to tap Into a song in Spotify and can't because it doesn't exist rather then finding the specific skill

content: alexa ability to hear when you first speak is hit and miss. Most times I have a shout and repeat multiple times.

title: Three Stars
content: Sound quality just not there. Buy the dot and a Bose mini sound link

title: Not quite what I was expecting.  But not giving up...yet.
content: It comes with absolutely no instructions, they expect you to buy that separately, it is moderately difficult to set up. It is really very limited in what it can actually do unless you spend hundreds to thousands of dollars worth of extra hardware to animate your home. I am glad I did not pay full price for this because I would be sending it back for sure! So as of right now it's just a real expensive version of a  web search device. I already have one of those, and it works much better, in a Siri device. I was curious to see how this device is going to work so I was glad to only pay half the normal price and at that I feel I payed too much.  The device has a very difficult time regardless of what they say understanding you from across the room with any type of background noise whatsoever. Even something as simple as a fan can wash out the capability for it to listen to you let alone if you're playing music or anything else over the device. As it stands right now I cannot recommend this device. I hope to update that in the future I plan to keep it and keep working with it, but hopes are not very high.

title: Good, just not what I wanted in a speaker.
content: Sounds quality is good. It does exactly what it says. I just did not realize that she needs to be plugged in to work. There is no carrying her from room to room when your favorite song is on. For that reason, I think I will be returning a getting a Bose or JBL speaker.

title: The learning capability of a Beagle but still fun.
content: I seem to be much less impressed than the average owner of this device but seriously, my $50 android phone does far, far more with voice commands than the echo and I didn't need to teach my phone a thing.  Maybe my Echo belongs on the short bus but it seems fairly stupid and the training isn't doing a lot of good.  It still can't tell me how to calculate the hypotenuse of a triangle whereas my google enabled phone can respond to my voiced question and give me a voiced answer instantaneously (did I mention it was $50).  I tied my iheart radio account to Alexa with the app and about 50% of the time I get "your iheart radio account is not tied to your echo, please do so in the app", the other half of the time, it's fine.

title: Act like Google!
content: It can't get what I ask half of the time. I wish it can be like Google,

title: Still learning how to use it. Accessories are expensive ...
content: Still learning how to use it. Accessories are expensive. Probably wait for the Apple version to compare features, advantages, and benefits.

title: I really liked my echo dots so I ordered an Echo to ...
content: I really liked my echo dots so I ordered an Echo to get the better speaker...  but the speaker isn't really all that great.  The sound is still a bit tinny and there is not enough bass.  I also wish Alexa was more context aware, for example if I say "Alexa turn on the light" she'll ask me which light.  It should be obvious that I mean for it to turn on the light for the room I'm in.  Similarly if I ask her to adjust the thermostat she'll ask me which device.  I only have one.

title: Don't Buy Echo for Music.
content: Alexa technology is great. Speaker is unbelievably poor.
Not as useful as I expected. Came close to sending it back!!

title: Three Stars
content: Would not connect to cingk Bluetooth.

title: not to bad
content: Well......so far not to bad. Had some issues. 1 Skills...they have to be put in one a time, than, you have to remember how to initiate that skill to perform that function. 2...  I will say " play Amazon rain forest " it plays a song, yet I have the rain forest sounds to sleep. 3... I will ask her to spell " probability " it comes back with " I'm not quite sure ". Really? I have been an Apple guy for some time now. I ask Siri to set reminder, spell, locate, or whatever. It's spot on. Rare that I get " I'm not quite sure."  When it is working, not bad at all. It keeps my list for shopping, but so does my pencil and paper. Maybe, I need to be upgraded. It plays my Amazon music, it gives me my Flash Briefing, which I do enjoy. I can get on the computer, shave, or some thing else while the briefing is going on. That's great, maybe I just have to get the hang of things better. We will wait and see. FYI, I made this purchase during Prime day July 11, at half price, why not. Hope this helps. Have a great day.....

title: Three Stars
content: I feel like I have to scream at her for it to listen to me

title: Mediocre performance. Disappointing.
content: Music library does not include current hits without a monthly subscription.  Many questions go unanswered by Alexa, but are available on Google and Siri.

title: Expected more
content: For $180, I would honestly expect more from this. You would really need a house full of SMARTS to use this to its full potential. If you don't, you might find yourself bored with it. I have a Nest thermostat, wemo switch and ooma. Those do work fairly well but I find myself using more of my phone apps to make adjustments more than using Alexa. My daughter uses it to help her spell words when we're not close by. In order to use Echo you need to download the app and sign in or create an Amazon account. Then download your desired SKILLS (basically apps) in order to get certain use out of it. Otherwise, Alexa doesn't know a whole lot. Apps are pretty limited too from what I've seen so far and many are limited to what they can do. Sometimes, it doesn't pick up my voice/command even when I'm just several feet from it. But when it does, it does a pretty good job at distinguishing your voice from background noise and voices. It'll pick up whatever I'm saying even when my TV is playing at louder volumes which I find pretty impressive. The speaker itself is pretty good but not great for certain music. Not balanced at all. My UE Boom sounds way better. Bass is almost non existent at higher volumes so if you like songs with bass, don't keep your hopes up. If you have a for example an iPhone and plan on having it play music from your music app, you can control it with Alexa via Bluetooth. But if you ask to play certain songs or artists, it will play from the Prime Music if you have it.

title: I didn't find this very useful. it is very limited on what it can ...
content: I didn't find this very useful. it is very limited on what it can do. can't integrate with your phone so you can make calls. doesn't understand most questions. if you fall and need 911 it can't call. I want something that can do more than time my brownies order paper towels and play some music

title: Probably be great if a lot of other items are connected to ...
content: It's okay. Not worth the money. Work decently but use is just having it start much via voice. Can't do any search for you, not as effective as I believe it would be. Probably be great if a lot of other items are connected to it to control but stand alone it's an expensive voice actived speaker

title: Amazing device trying to be too much and spread too thin
content: I bought Echo on Prime Day exclusively for streaming music. It has app-specific problems. On Spotify it won't play my playlists. On SiriusXM it drops constantly. I have yet to get it to play an entire song without dropping. It does fine with Amazon Music but has yet to find my entire library. The Echo is packed with functionality and great apps. I wish the music apps worked better. I also have a Fire Stick that doesn't appear functional with Echo.

title: Three Stars
content: Not quite as smart as Google

title: Not meeting most of it yet. Trouble trying to ...
content: Not meeting most of it yet. Trouble trying to sync with logitech hub. And echo dot!!

title: not great not good not bad either
content: This is an ok product, not great not good not bad either. My first and foremost complaint is that everytime I ask it to play a song it asks for an upgraded spotify account. I was not aware I needed to buy one for this device to work spotify or even look for music. It does not find my music I have downloaded on my computer and the only way I hear music is if I use my pandora account which doesn't need to be upgraded. Works great for everything besides music. Used it to find closing times of a restaurant, wikipedia random things, and generally be silly. I think I will keep it and play with it some more. And see if there is a way around the spotify problem or see if there is a way to stop it from reminding me I need a spotify premium account every hour on the hour.

title: Sound muddy at low volumes
content: Sound is muddy at lower "background music" audio levels. Perhaps the built in loundness compensation is doing this. If I could adjust treble and bass, I might be able to overcome this, but there is no way to adjust them.

title: Plays music well, does other things barely.
content: Smart Home is my main purpose for getting the Echo, even though music is it most common use.  I am using this device as a novelty and I waited all these years to get one because it was pulled along with my move to the Internet of Things (IoT).  I am adopting the IoT to allow me to better run AirBnB, and for that reason I need to automate lights, locks, and doors.  There is a steep learning curve, I ordered the Amazon Echo because all these things I wanted to get for my "Smart" home said Alexa compatible.  I had some dream that I could just talk to the Echo and have Alexa do all the heavy lifting.  The primary driver for this and not an app was so that other people in my household could also scream at the Echo and have Alexa do my chores for me.  I changed from talk to scream because if I talk in a normal voice the Echo misses as often as it hits (hears).  I am a bit hoarse as I write this from recently having screamed at my Echo a lot while on a tech support call.  I primarily wanted Alexa to do 3 things - 1) unlock the dead bolt in the front door, 2) turn lights outside front door on and off, and 3) use as a two way device to talk with people at my front door (via Ring or other similar doorbell).  1) Alexa will not unlock my deadbolt in the front door.  Alexa will only lock the deadbolt in the front door if it is named "front door" or has the word "lock" after another name.  For example "Alexa, lock <dead bolt>" doesn't work.  If you rename <dead bolt> to <dead bolt lock> then "Alexa, lock <dead bolt lock>" will lock your dead bolt.  I even tried "Alexa lock <poo donkey lock>" and that worked.  But if you say "Alexa, lock <poo donkey>" then Alexa tells you how to ask questions about donkeys.  I use <> to denote the literal name of the device as assigned to my Wink Hub 2, and all the names given appear verbatim in the discovered devices under smart home.  2) The light switch controls haven't arrived yet, so we will see.  Finally the two way device to talk with people at my front door: fail, but not Alexa's fault.  The video doorbells all use WiFi and don't have this level of advertised compatibility.  Final score 1) Fail, 2) N/A, 3) Fail because N/A.  I gave this 3 out of 5 stars because it recognizes most things I say even if Alexa has no idea what to do once it knows what I said.  I also gave it 3 out of 5 because I only have to scream half the time.  If you set music to 10 then good luck getting the microphone to work - even if you stand right over the echo.  I really think the technology isn't there yet but if you are an early adopter you can get some satisfaction from it.  If you wanted to have a hands free life of technological wizardy - keep dreaming.

The sound quality is impressive and the voice control works much better that I thought. So when I get my new one I hope to revise my review to 5 stars.

The games available for alexa are not nearly as entertaining as the one provided by the google home. The vaunted recipe use that is shown in the advertisements have terrible reviews. Beyond the neat factor of telling it to turn on music, or lower the temperature on your nest this product is definitely not worth 180, luckily I got it on prime day for 90. Even at 90 dollars it is still a stretch given the poor speaker quality.

Also, I JUST got my Amazon Echo and the device already seems like it struggles at a certain volume. I watched a video of sound comparison between the Echo and the Dot before I bought the Echo. It sounded like the Echo had really good sound quality. I never listen to my device at a volume over level 8, yet sometimes the bass still sounds muffled.

title: OK, but be weary of purchasing with Echo
content: I bought an Echo on Prime Day for $89.95, for one reason only; because it is rumored that I'll be able to voice control my Sonos audio by the end of 2017.  The headline is that you should be weary of buying Amazon products through your Echo!  More on that below.  So far I've set up my Echo and experimented with its abilities and "Skills".  Skills are mini-apps that are written by third parties to give the Echo some special ability not built-in to the product.  I've only scratched the surface of the constantly growing universe of skills, but at this point I am dizzy from trying to remember what command I must utter to invoke specific skills.  For instance, the Echo can natively play almost any podcast under the sun, but native operation is disapointingly lacking.  The skill called AnyPod does add the ability to fast forward or rewind by X seconds or Minutes which is lacking in the Echo native podcast ability, but I now must remember to utter... "Alexa, ask AnyPod to rewind 10 Seconds".  The same extra invocations are necessary for many skills i.e. "Alexa, ask Fidelity for stock prices" etc.  I also own a Google Home, the competitor to Amazon's Echo and these requests are handled much more intuitively through the Google Home device.

title: Alexa seems to have a better speaker for music

I almost have to walk up and enunciate directly at Alexa for her to respond to me, which is rather frustrating.  Google seems to have access to more info.  I asked Alexa what time the BLM office in Spokane opens today and she had no idea.  Google answered correctly right away.  Alexa seems to have a better speaker for music.

content: Makes a very good Bluetooth speaker.  I have a hard time understanding what Alexa is saying. I assume it is because I wear hearing aids.  However, since I can read what she is saying in the app I don't miss too much. It's an interesting devise, but I'm not sure I would buy it again.

title: Just okay for now. Hoping for more once I can connect to a wireless system.
content: I understand there is a learning curve to discovering all ECHO has to offer, but I can't say it's much more advanced than a smartphone. Perhaps once I get the interconnecting systems (i.e., wemo) that allow ECHO to control your "smart home equipment", I will find more use for it. Until then, it's a cylinder that we all holler at to little avail. Even my 21 month old granddaughter gets perturbed when she doesn't play songs from 'Moana' (it's pretty cute watching her telling this cylinder to play "Shiny", though).

title: Bad understanding about themes
content: Basic functions like playing music, volume up/down, or checking weather are ok.  However, Alexa is really bad at handling or understanding the music by themes, i.e. "Alexa, play some music for breakfast" or "Alexa, play some soft rock music", or "Alexa, play some hotel lounge music". Alexa couldn't understand it or sometimes come back with the songs unmatched the themes.

title: Amazon Echo
content: Amazon Echo is fair compared to Google Home.  I don't dislike it or regret the purchase. It doesn't seem to acknowledge rooms identified on my Phillips Hue as well as Google Home, just being honest.  The search engine is limited as well.  It will be fine for what I need it for.  If I would not have purchased during the Amazon Prime day I might have been a bit disappointed but considering the discounted price I got it for I will keep it and utilize it.

title: I hope she gets smarter....
content: It's ok.  Stay away from mathematics, old English words, physics, astronomy, and other questions an average college educated person may have forgotten.  She doesn't do research. Stick with peripheral things; like turning on lamps or TV, daily news briefing, weather, or ordering a pizza.  If you're looking for a tool with complexity, this isn't it.

title: Lots of potential but still lots of room for improvements.

Hopefully the competition from Google and Apple will spur improvements across-the-board, similar to what happened with smartphones.

Even though I have enjoyed those things, It does not seem worth the cost.  I intend to add more echo capable devices throughout the house and perhaps that will raise my review.  One thing that has really bothered me, during an important conversation between my spouse and I, Alexa asked a question in the correct context when neither of us used the trigger word. It made us both very uncomfortable. We felt like we had been spied on.  My wife hid in the laundry room for a while. :)

title: Still giving it time but voice recognition is getting better, the enabling of skills through the app is ...
content: Still giving it time but voice recognition is getting better, the enabling of skills through the app is the worst thing about it. If you are going to claim easy user friendly then make it that way, I just don't understand why everything needs to be enabled when it would be easier to have things disabled that you don't want. I'm sure there is a number of things the Echo is capable of doing but I don't know unless I search through usless skills that I have activate to see how it is then go to the next.

title: The speech recognition is not bad, but there are some glaring misses that will ...
content: Okay I guess. The speech recognition is not bad, but there are some glaring misses that will hopefully be ironed out in future releases of the app. I use it for music that I have uploaded - so I consider it fairly primitive even for that. I don't know if there's any local storage in the thing - it's a shame that you have to consume bandwidth each time you want to listen to the same song - I mean, how hard is it to provide about 1 GB of flash storage locally? It's no Google-Now that's for sure - I get way better answers out of Google.  Simple things like "what songs do I have in my library" or "can you list the songs in my library" give you "Hmm.. I'm not sure." Crap :) What I do know is the kids working in this group in AMZN make about 200k  a year with stocks, so there's obviously some heavy engineering behind it for sure.

title: FUN
content: I do like it, but I have a lot of trouble getting her to hear or follow my requests, as if she doesn't hear me.

title: Web search is pretty rudimentary at this moment
content: Web search is pretty rudimentary at this moment. Alexa will tell you who the 22nd US President is, or what time it is in Belize, but she won't even hazard a guess or a Wikipedia search for more esoteric questions while Siri and OK Google will at least attempt to. This I guess prevents her from giving incorrect information or a response that doesn't answer the question, but nothing ventured, nothing gained, Alexa.

title: Three Stars

title: We'll see. I don't have a "smart" home so ...
content: We'll see. I don't have a "smart" home so those capabilities aren't yet needed. Plays music. Answers some questions and not others. Got it during Prime day so deeply discounted.

title: Not very useful right now. SIRI has more personality than Alexa.
content: It works well for what it does. I use it for a timer and alarm clock. Alexa voice recognition is excellent, though it isn't clever like SIRI. If you insult Alexa it responds as if it doesn't understand, so it's not as entertaining as SIRI.  I got Echo for a gift so it was free. I wouldn't buy one, because for me it has a very limited use. I am not an Amazon prime member or have pay music services, so I can't really control music with it and I don't buy music by the song. It will start and stop the music I have stored from CDs as a collection, but Alexa can't find albums or individual songs I've stored. SIRI is better at finding things. Since I have different brand internet switches(pre-Echo) it is not compatible with them, so I can't control them. Since I have an app on my iPhone, SIRi can control these switches. There is no way to make Echo compatible, other than rebuy the switch. Since I use these switches to control my whole home music system it might be worth it to rebuy, but not now.. Someday when there are lots of things with compatible control capabilities integrated, Echo could be pretty good, but I imagine it will be quite expensive to convert to compatible devices. Right now to me it's not worth it. Stressing the product works very well, but to me it's a solution looking for a problem. Also you must be careful what you say. If you say, "Alexa" in any manner it comes on and is listening for a command. You can shut that off, but you then are totally defeating the purpose of the device.

title: Three Stars

title: Three Stars

title: A little disappointed

Like how many ounces there are in a glass of wine - She says that she does not know.  She does give news highlights and also does good with the weather and music.  But general questions, not good.

title: Ok, But not Great
content: I decided to try this out during the recent Prime member sale. Great price. I already have a Google home unit, so I was interested in how they compared. I subscribed to the Amazon unlimited music offer to give me a few months to test out.  Following is my quick comparison.

title: 3 Stars for now
content: I'll give it a 3 for now.  It's cool and all but it can't find "my music" in the Amazon cloud half the time AND there is no tone control.  Getting access to my lecture material was the main reason I got the echo.  Some speech files are a bit heavy on bass so it would be nice to either turn the bass down or the treble up.  I got tired of a hit and miss on my finding my playlist that I resorted to Paring with my cellphone...but I can do that with other USB speakers that have tone controls..

title: Doesn't recognize my voice a lot of times and sometimes ...
content: Doesn't recognize my voice a lot of times and sometimes when I'm asking something it will shut off as soon as I say "Alexa".

title: I'm a little disappointed, I thought I could use this as a ...
content: I'm a little disappointed, I thought I could use this as a hands free speaker for my phone, but that isn't the case. You can only call someone else that has an echo. Come on Amazon, what's so hard about making this a hands free speaker.

title: Nice features. Kids love using it as well
content: Nice features. Kids love using it as well. Integrates well with applications.

title: What's the big deal here?
content: I got it at 50% off on Prime Day. And I still have no idea why people find echo so useful, especially at full price. My kids and I have found it somewhat amusing at best.

title: I'm disappointed! I can't sync my Iphone calendar with Alexa
content: I'm disappointed!  I can't sync my Iphone calendar with Alexa.  I can't even verbally add events to my  calendar very well; she doesn't understand me very well.  I asked Alexa to remind me at 4:00 p.m. to ask my daughter a question and I got no such reminder.  I can verbally add things to my to do lists but I can't verbally delete anything from my to do list.  She refers me to the Echo App.  The only four things so far that Alexa is doing well is 1) she gives me the weather 2) she plays music that is free through Amazon Prime, and 3) she reads books that I purchased in the past through audible, and 4) I've verbally ordered from Amazon.  Be carefully, Alexa will costs you more money!  It's tricky ordering things from Alexa because you are not seeing what you are ordering (so unless you've ordered something before be careful).  Also -- I ordered the ECHO on Prime Day and I mistakenly ordered a black ECHO and I meant to order a white one.  Without paying to send the echo back, there was no way for me to get the black echo replaced for a white one.  In fact  when I was chatting online with an Amazon  customer service person, they disconnected me when I  explained my problem.  I wanted to exchange it for a white echo.  They wouldn't even let me explain that i would have been willing to pay the postage; I just wanted to keep the 'sales' price.

title: Amazon Echo is Cool, but not THAT cool

However, in today's modern tech world, unless you have a bunch of smart home devices, I find Echo limited to setting timers, playing music (in a clunky manner), and giving me newsflashes 99% of the time.  These skills alone, and getting this on sale, is probably a good enough value to justify the purchase.

title: Alexa called and woke me up at 4:30 am for some unknown reason. Alexa is now blocked from my iphone.
content: Until today I was fairly happy with Echo, but right now I'm mad at it.  When cooking I use it regularly for a timer, and to convert measurements (like cups to tablespoons) . It will wake me up in the morning (although I set a back-up alarm in case of power outage). I ask the time, when waking up at night, or have it play a podcast if I cannot sleep. In the morning I listen to the news and weather...in short, I use several of the skills regularly throughout my day.

So many of the Echo-related e-mails I have received since purchasing this have been regarding how simple and easy buying more crap can be with Alexa. CHILL. I literally wanted to stream some music without pairing my phone to a bluetooth speaker.

title: Online Music Stops Playing
content: I already had an Echo Dot and during the Prime sale I decided to get the bigger Echo and the Tap.  Really enjoy these devices except for this recent issue.  I'll tell Alexa to play soft jazz and she brings up a playlist from Amazon music, but after a few hours it stops playing, doesn't matter which Alexa powered device.  I don't have any timers scheduled.  Contacting Amazon support for this has been a waste of time, it's like they don't know their own products.  They had me reset the device, which didn't fix the issue.  This only seems to happen when it gets the music online, works fine if I use it as a bluetooth speaker.  My home Wifi is fast and solid, so it's not losing a connection there.  Anyone else having this issue?

title: A Good Device, If You Have A Linked Amazon Account
content: I received this as a gift, after hearing about it, for quite some time. I don't have an Amazon membership, so I don't have access to Amazon music, etc. After trying a few of the features, I realized I have more flexibility using Siri, on my iPhone, because she can play the music saved to my phone, my podcasts, etc. Siri can also look up information on the internet, like Alexa.  I enjoyed playing Jeopardy, but on the latest round, Alexa stopped in the middle of the questions. If I turn the volume up, at a certain point, she can't hear me, when I give voice commands, so I have to walk over, to turn her down. I have a smart thermostat, but I forgot the password to my account, so I can't hook Alexa up, until I reset my password. Sounds like a helpful feature.

title: Didn't seem to be able to give answers to all our questions

I asked the same question over and over and tried very hard to enunciate "transfer station" as clearly as possible but it kept giving me the PUD.  Don't know if the name was too long or why it couldn't pick up "transfer station".  I also got quite of few "Hmmm, I don't know" answers on other questions.  We are returning it and will try Google Home, hopefully, it will give us better answers.

title: Great -- if it was a Beta-release
content: The Echo has so much potential, but it still feels like something in a beta-release, not a finished product that's been on the market for a while.  What it does well--it listens well, rarely misinterprets voice commands, plays radio stations, podcasts, music, and audible books pretty much the way one expects (as long as the user uses the anypod-skill for podcasts--there's really no control with Alexa's podcast player). title: Alexa Is Mentally Challenged
content: If Alexa were a child, she would be borderline mentally retarded. For having been for sale as long as it has (the Echo), and for Alexa to have been in use by as many people as it is (for as long as it has), the product has not come close to meeting my expectations. Alexa confuses simple things that context should easily clarify. For example, "the number of ounces in a gallon?" is clearly a question of volume, and yet Alexa answers this in terms of mass- incorrectly, I might add. Music playing is predominantly all it is good for, and without a LOT of interaction and setup on my part, it fails spectacularly at that too. I should be able to say, "do not play R&B music" and have it understood that any music within this genre should be excluded from requests to play music. However, Alexa instead plays ONLY R&B music. Commands for volume control while available must be repeated 2-3 times to reach any meaningful adjustment. The list goes on and on. The fact that at this point in time, there is no connectivity or interaction with FireTV or FireStick is woefully unforgivable. Alexa's 'skills' require not only downloading, but invocation by 'name' at each use, and memorization of skill related commands/syntax- which makes them largely useless. Who can remember more than 2 or 3 of the myriad skills available for download? Her inability to answer simple questions that could simply be read from a search engine query is mind boggling. For being as good as it is at speech recognition, and for all the resources Amazon has presumably thrown at this, there is really no excuse for not being able to translate queries into reasonable answers any better than it does, other than really bad coding. Save your money, this device isn't remotely ready for prime time, and you are essentially paying to sign up to be a beta-tester. It's not much better at other vendors.

Of course, starting over only means playing that one song.  I have tried everything to get it to play like it did when I first got it (2 weeks ago) and even talked to technical support at length and they couldn't understand why it is doing this or how to resolve it, so I am returning for a replacement.  If the replacement does this, I will be returning for a refund.  Can't keep messing with it. It's a lot of fun but when it stops working properly after 2 weeks, that's a problem.  I'll update in a bit, I'll give this one a month TOPS before I decide whether to keep it or not.  I want it to work but if it doesn't, I cannot deal with defective electronics.

title: Currently just a gimmick and toy
content: Echo is a basically an attempt to make a robot that can do task to make a person's life easier. In the future, there will likely be naive robots which can learn to do anything just by instructing it to download a task from the internet.  However, the biggest problem with echo lies in the software programming of it and the skills are too keyword driven. Once a skill is added to echo it should be smart enough to perform a function without using the exact keyword to initiate the skill. For example, once I download "Can I Stream" I should be able to ask Alexa "Can I stream Prometheus". But no, you must ask Alexa "Ask can I stream can I stream Prometheus." Even though the skill has been added to Alexa one still has to open it with exact keywording before Alexa finds a brain. A lot more extensive software programming is needed to make this enjoyable versus aggravating. It would be nice to have some top of the line skills that cost $50 to $100 that perform more than rudimentary functions.

Gets really frustrating and disappointing when I have to try 6-7 times (saying my request faster, or slower) before my music is played.  Most times I give up.  It's not just with my voice, but with 2 other people giving the commands - does same thing.

Overall it is a toy as opposed to a modern appliance that is supposed to help you.

title: Speaker is o.k, if that is all you want it for.
content: Speaker is ok, but that's about it.  I ask for a radio station one day I get it, next day it understands the same thing, but does not give correct station.  Says "I don't know" or go to the Alexa App.  Alexa app says not supported on my fire.  Price was cut in half three weeks after I purchased. That really made her even less attractive.  It's just a smart speaker that give time, weather, short news update and new music playlist for an extra $3.95 a month more for prime members, and only works on the Echo.  I should of waited on Apple's because that is were my music is.  Bluetooth will not connect to my iPad.

title: It's good for music

title: Great Idea - Much Room for Functionality Improvement.
content: Nice idea. Cute.  The problem I have with it is the functionality is extremely limited.  Siri - Apple - can usually respond to a much richer or more complex queries than Alexa can.  Also - the device is a bit self-centered. Example: Spotify on five devices around the house - Spotify connect is symmetrical - I can control on one device and listen on another.  If I ask Alexa to get involved, she immediately switches the listening device to be her....unfortunately the Sound quality of Alexa will never match a Yamaha 9 channel surround system so this is a bit funny...if not infuriating. The email connections are poor, as is calendar.  If I ask Alexa to connect to my outlook email account and read my email - no.  Or texts - no.  So I see the basis for a great personal assistant in the future, but we have a long way to go.  Hopefully Amazon doesn't make the mistake of only connecting Alexa to Amazon stuff....if so I will dump her.  The light ring is cute, and the voice recognition is extremely good...but again the functionality behind the recognition engine is very limited.

title: Searching With Alexa On The Echo Is Worthless
content: There are some things I like about the Echo but the search engine is most definitely not one of them. I asked Alexa 10 questions or more about Soccer, the NFL, and other things and for a majority of them she replied "I don't know". This provides absolutely no help when trying to find information, and that's one of the primary reasons I wanted the Echo.  Amazon needs to significantly improve the search engine or use another one and they need to do that right now. Otherwise it's not worth the money.

title: Alexa is going to be amazing..
content: Alexa is going to be amazing...but she's not quite there yet.locked to her skills-Alexa's utility is presently limited.  I bought Alexa for an elderly person who relies on voice operated devices (as a result of inability to use their full faculties).alexa responds poorly to low voice commands but her she tends to switch off and does not respond well to installation of skills through voice commends.  if a person is relying on Alexa to the extent that's the person I bought Alexa for is relying,then this will be a deeply frustrating experience.alexa will have good utility for people using her for entertainment-but she is tempermental.i subsequently and at the same time as above,purchased an Alexa for myself and find that Alexa will tend to switch off if she does not know the answer to something.  She does not like to update her skills through voice commands and prefers if you log into the account.linking to Spotify and playing requested music is painfully slow.  Alexa is unable to be fully functional yet but as a device with great prospects I recommend her for the tech junkies.  I do not however recommend her for people who rely on voice command in need to entertainment or stimulation-she will not like your low voice and will prefer you log into your account to do something which means having to wait for someone else to do it for you.

title: Disappointed
content: After extensive research and watching online reviews I made the decision to purchase the Amazon Echo during prime day with the hope that it would live up to the hype. Unfortunately in the 2 weeks since it has arrived I have had several problems with it's performance.The biggest issue I have had is with Alexa responding to voice commands. I have tried to correct this by eliminating any noise in the room while speaking and even moving closer to speaker with the hope it will resolve the problem but unfortunately it did not. The second issue that I have been experiencing is with Alexa responding with "loss of connection" or I cannot answer that right now" which is extremely frustrating. I have recently reset the device hoping it will correct some of these issues but the performance has not changed. When the Echo is working I really enjoy it but to have this many problems over a 2 week makes me second guess my purchase.

title: Alexia app is the most generic I have ever seen. Sound is just blah. Lower your expectations
content: I was very excited to get Echo. I bought this so i could eventually add the dots and have music throughout my house. I am very disappointed with the speaker sound while playing music. I cant imagine how bad the dots will sound since they are smaller. The Alexa app is so amatureish and so generic. I hate that you have to say "Alexa" Everytime you want it to do something. Even immediately after telling it a command. This needs bigger sound. Maybe they should partner with Bose on the sound quality although doing that would price a lot of people out of buying it. It only comes directions to tell you to plug it in and download the joke of an Alexa app. Then the app tells you how to connect to your wifi. Other then that you either search the internet on how to use the features or call costumer service. If you are looking to buy this more more a music speaker dont be fooled by people's reviews on how great the sound is because its just ok. Im sad. Very sad for buying. ☹️

title: Very weak performer
content: I have had the Echo for about two weeks now and I must compare it to the Google app on the android phone. Echo comes in at a very distant second place to Google. Speech recognition is mediocre - too many mistakes in requests and I do speak English as my native language - there is no excuse for the poor word recognition. All too often requests are met with "hmmm, I don't think I know that". Specific song requests are too often met with an invitation to subscribe to the Amazon music program. Quite often the answers to questions are not usable unlike Google which provides excellent responses. The sound is quite good and it looks good but overall, I wish I had bought a Google Home.

title: Defective and Doesn't Live up to the Hype
content: I gave this item 2 stars because it's quite fun to use--- when it actually works. The setup was a bit tedious, but once it is up and running, it seems to work well if there is no noise interference around the unit. This speaker is quite loud for it's size, and I love that I can stream all of my music through it and request flash briefings. However, the claim that Alexa can hear you over the noise from the speaker is a complete lie. It has never worked for me. I had this set up in my home for only two weeks before it was completely unusable. I tried to start my day in the usual fashion by playing music and was answered by an obnoxiously loud white noise (kind of like the sound that came with "snowy" channels on old school T.V.'s). The sound would not stop until I completely unplugged the unit. Alexa would not respond to voice prompts while this noise was happening. I called Amazon support and they tried to troubleshoot the problem, but it seemed as though they had little to no idea what had caused this, and even less of an idea as to how we could fix it. Ultimately, they placed an order for a replacement unit. I am now waiting for the new unit to arrive, and have very low expectations for how long this thing will actually last. To me, this was a waste of money, and I would have been much better off ordering a bluetooth speaker.

The Amazon Tech stated "we would need the Dish hopper to connect Alexa device to our TV through the Dish TV skill. You would need to link the hopper with the skill which will allow Alexa to control your TV through Voice commands."  We don't have the Dish Hopper!  The Amazon Tech stated "In this case, I've personally forwarded your concern to our Alexa Development team for further review and consideration. I'm sure they will look into this and find a best possible way to connect the Alexa device  to Smart TV directly."

She eventually gave up and indicated that because I hadn't purchased it myself through an authorized retailer I was out of luck.  If you're looking for an expensive paper weight this is a great route to go.

Well, that day will never come.  I picked up the device to clean underneath it.  It worked fine before I picked it up and now it's dead.  I tried resetting the device.  Nothing.  No lights.  Nothing.  Customer service says I need to buy a new power cord.  Why would picking up the Echo to clean underneath it and putting it back down cause the power cord to go bad?  New power cord arrived and the device STILL does not work.  After just over a year of very light use, my Echo is now a very expensive paperweight.  Don't waste your money.  Worthless.

title: "Alexa, please don't die right after your warranty ends"
content: "Alexa, why did you stop working all of a sudden? "Alexa, please return yourself to Amazon". Nope. Our Echo decided to just die this morning. It's about a year and a half old (a gift from our son) and of course the warranty is only for a year.  Now I understand hardware very well, but this degree of low reliability coupled with the fact that I spent 45 minutes today talking to three people (support, then Echo tech support and then a "member of the leadership team") to no avail tells me that Amazon has been, is and will continue to be a lousy hardware company. We buy literally tens of thousands of dollars a year from Amazon, yet they fail to keep this customer happy by not offering to replace this dud unit and instead offering a promotion of 50%/$50 (they couldn't even get their offer straight between the two people that made offers.)

title: Useless spyware (Save your money)
content: This is a useless addition to your daily routine. It is advertised as "revolutionary", however that could not be farther from the truth. As advertised, the so called Alexa can add items to your shopping list, but if its faulty voice capturing system misreads your item whilst its selling your private conversations to the NSA and CCP, you cannot simply ask Alexa to revise the misinterpreted list, you must manually navigate the Alexa app to change this. The flaws with Alexa run deeper than this however, as it seems even Alexa itself has no idea what it's purpose is, let alone how to even accomplish the basic tasks programmed into it. Alexa's incompetence can be clearly defined when you delve deeper into the "question asking interface" now as some have noticed you can ask Alexa fun and quirky questions like "who lives in a pineapple under the sea?" And get a response saying "spongebob square pants!" Now while you're laughing and parting your husband Jim on the back for another quality anniversary gift, (12 years is your Alexa anniversary) you neglect to realize that this is the quintessential flaw with this glorified cylindrical Siri. To truly understand the disapointment behind this creation you must travel back to 2013 when Siri was first released, everyone was abuzz about the voice control and Siri's quirky sense of humor, however eventually everyone realized that "wait this is useless" and stopped using it. Flash forward half a decade later... And nothing has changed. Alexa has a lot on the surface but no substance other than that. You can get the same use out of Alexa that you could out of a pad of paper, the joke book you bought when you were best man at your pal dave's third wedding, and a calendar, or better yet, your Phone! I'm not going to extend this review longer than necessary, but I will end it with a simple example that illustrates everything Alexa is in its simplicity. When I asked Alexa what I assumed was a very simple question to test the depth of its knowlege it faltered and made me realize how useless it really is. I cleared my throat and said plainly, careful to enunciate every syllable, "Alexa, who fought in the Spanish American war?" Her answer: "hmmm I don't know that one"

title: Don't waste your time!
content: We got this echo and we were very excited to have a new toy. Unfortunately the set up was a nightmare. We tried on our laptop but it constantly spun and never connected to the site. Then we tried it on our i-phone which also had difficulty connecting. I called the customer service number and eventually was able to connect to the alexa app on the iphone, but it got as far as a page that said "unable to connect to the web page" which was necessary to finish setting up the echo. The man on the phone kept putting me on hold to look for ideas, and I tried the Amazon BSN network which the iphone deemed unsafe but nothing would finish the set up. The tech I was talking to disconnected me after over an hour. I looked up advice on the internet and followed those directions again with the same results. While I was on the phone my husband looked at the amazon reviews on my Apple i-phone and they were consistently bad - I wish I had looked at these before purchasing. According to the reviews the app is extremely slow (once you are able to set it up!

title: Quit working after one year
content: I absolutely LOVED my Echo. I purchased it from a large, reputable electronics retailer in April 2016. Unfortunately, it quit working a month past the warranty. The Echo stopped responding one day (no lights, sounds or any kind of response). I worked through all of the recommended steps from unplugging the Echo, unplugging my router and modem and restarting everything to performing a factory reset and trying a new power adaptor. Nothing worked. I contacted Amazon about this. Amazon confirmed that my Echo no longer worked and I was offered a 15 percent discount on the purchase of a new Echo. After spending close to $200 on a product that lasted 13 months, this offer fell flat with me. I chose to write this review to warn others that the issue with my Echo (dying after a year) is a common issue. This is a great product, but the quality isn't there. If you purchase it, be sure to get the extra warranty coverage and factor that into the total cost of the purchase. Amazon needs to do a much better job of taking care of its loyal customers. This was a huge disappointment and definitely makes me think twice about ordering a larger ticket item from Amazon.

title: Unexpectedly died. Zero support. No Replacement. Not worth the price.
content: I would call this an eye opening purchase. I've used the Echo for quite a while and have loved it. It worked flawlessly and was an excellent device for the time it functioned. After it sitting on a shelf for over a year. It mysteriously lost all function. No lights, no sound, acted as though it was not receiving power. I tried multiple adapters and the "reset" button, followed the troubleshooting procedure and to no avail. Then I called Amazon's support team to what I would expect to be a straightforward replacement situation where the device had a fault and had failed. 2 hours and 7 people later all they could offer was a slight discount on purchasing a new echo...I'm not impressed. I have always utilized Amazon and their devices. I was a devout and loyal customer, after this experience I am surely shaken. I would not recommend this product to anyone who feels they should get more than 1 year usage out of it, as should it fail. You will be out the money and if you want a discount on your failed device a few hours of your time and quite a few redundant conversations with incompetent support staff. Amazon, my far you have fallen in my eyes. Buy a different device from another brand such as the google home, way lower price and you get the same type of support...I paid more, because I expected more from Amazon. Lesson Learned.

title: Disappointed in Amazon Echo!
content: So I purchased this product just around two years ago, and it has already stopped working. I only used it off and on as I ended up traveling considerably. So no regular use but sporadically over the last two years.  Looking back over my calendar, we're talking maybe 9 or 10 months of total use.  As of 2 months ago, the unit no longer worked.  I tried all the online suggestions - no success. Today I spoke with Amazon customer service who confirmed its defective, but as it's past the warranty date, they can only offer a 15% credit to purchase a new one.  Debating this now.  If the unit is only going to last a year of actual use, is it worth the $150 price tag? Likely not... Has anyone else had a similar experience with the Amazon Echo, or am I the unlucky one to have purchased a soon-to-be-defective product...?  Amazon tends to be great in their customer dealings, but in this case, I wish they'd replace the unit.  Warranty or not, these items should last much longer than this one did.  Has anyone here tried other companys' items? Any comparisons? Looking for advice.  Thanks!!

title: Performed like a star
content: The week I owned this, I would have given 5 stars.  Performed like a star.  Since that time, the Alexa disconnects from wifi everytime I use it, within 5 minutes (or less) I have spent more time rebooting routers, extenders, Alexa herself (reset).  It simply won't stay connected to wifi.  What's WORSE is that she will respond to request to play or set alarms.  When I ask her to stop, she "doesn't understand" (disconnected) and will not stop the music or alarms.  I even unplugged her to stop and when I replugged, she continued to replay alarm.  My wifi works for every device in our home.  Laptops, tablets, phone, wifi speakers.  EVERYTHING but the Echo.  I'm a computer tech, and can't get this device to work consistently, much less for more than 1 command.  I've reconnected her at least 20 times today, trying everything.  I could call and spend the 3 hours on the phone just to repeat what I have tried, but basically fried on the product.  Reset to original did not improve anything.  This produce is severely flawed in my opinion and a rip off.  Took the plunge for 1/2 price on sale day.  Sorry I did.  My VAVA wifi speaker works great.  I wanted Echo for the music and that, in and of itself has not been successful.  I will never purchase these Amazon devices again, much less all of the additions and security devices.  I loved it while it worked for the short 1 week.  Sad product, sad response for those who have problems, sad reflection of Amazon in my opinion!
